KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!0.000!DE.dialogue_text:
Eidos finds herself in an austere amphitheater nestled against the inner wall. Though perhaps the exact antithesis of ostentatious, it is no less remarkable for its impeccable architecture. A smooth, alabaster quarter-dome acts as the stage, a subtly translucent half-dome acting as the roof.

		Her footfalls echo from the stone surfaces all about, revealing the reasoning behind the placement of this structure. Surely a voice performing at the center of this stage would clearly reach all ears. Scanning the vacant stone benches, she can almost see a dim afterimage of an enthralled audience, cheering in raucous ecstasy.

		Though she knows Tacribians only for a bellicose nature, this area hints at a gentler side - the sheath to their sword.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!0.001!DE.dialogue_text: The brutish grunts of exertion from the nearby Proving Ground call her back to the stark reality of an empty theater. While this place is well-maintained, it is utterly forsaken, but for a solitary man of middle age, dutifully sweeping the area free of dust.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!1.000!DE.dialogue_text: Approaching the amphitheater, Eidos notices a dramatic change in the environs. Standing upon the stage is Kambin and more than a few Tacribians are watching him sing. The walls and the air betwixt him and the audience resonate with the silvery timbre of his voice. It seems he was holding back when at the Hydroponic facility in Tambul.\n\n\t\tEven folk in the Proving Ground seem to be taking note of the performance, as those resting look on with approving stares. Qust too has taken pause in his work to look upon the Tambulan cultivator.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!2.000!DE.dialogue_text: Approaching the amphitheater, Eidos notices a dramatic change in the environs. Standing upon the stage is Akkeber, cavorting about and gesticulating wildly as he weaves an epic tale in spoken song. Eidos sees that she is the sole audience member of the Forsaken Poet, as the Tacribians seem eager to ignore his impassioned performance. Even Qust seems to prefer the dust from the steps to the sub-mediocrity of the stage-infecting performer.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!3.000!DE.dialogue_text: Approaching the amphitheater, Eidos notices a dramatic change in the environs. Standing upon the stage is Kambin and more than a few Tacribians are watching him sing. The walls and the air betwixt him and the audience resonate with the silvery timbre of his voice. For better or for worse, he has been joined by Akkeber, who cavorts about as though in the grips of some ecstatic frenzy. Perhaps he is giving an interpretive dance of Kambin's folk song, but it would be impossible to plumb the depths of his unique motivations.\n\n\t\tEven folk in the Proving Ground seem to be taking note of the performance, as those resting from exercise look on with a mixture of appreciation and confusion. Qust too has taken pause in his work to look upon the juxtaposition of atrocity and melodiousness.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!4.000!DE.dialogue_text:
Eidos sees that there is a great deal of activity transpiring in the Proving Grounds, clearly visible through the nearly translucent dome and equally audible through the doors leading in.

		However, in stark relief to the bustling exterior is a seemingly abandoned structure built from dark, brown sandstone. While it is impressive in size, more remarkable is that it bears an austere beauty unparalleled by the other structures of this fortress. Furthermore, the contentious Tacribian aqueduct appears to have emptied into this structure before it ran dry.

		Looking to the imposing walls, Eidos sees that there is a staircase leading to the top of the battlements, though no one seems to be using them currently.

A.response_text: Climb the stairs to the top of the wall

C.response_text: Go back to the Proving Grounds

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!4.X002!D.dialogue_text: Eidos walks towards the whiskered groundskeeper. Before she can call out to him, he quickly turns to meet her, his keen eyes brimming with awareness.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!0099.000.dialogue_text: Before the middle-aged Tacribian warrior can succumb to injuries, a look of proud determination falls upon a point behind Eidos. Turning about, she sees that summons unheard have called forth the master of this fortress. The sinewy frame of Khlutt, commander of the Tacribian League, now silently glides into the Amphitheater.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!0099.001.dialogue_text: Moving with a feline grace, the rhythmic click of the mage's hobnail sandals upon sand mark the time as he paces a circle about her. His face has all the emotion and stability of a stone archway, yet unambiguously promises a fight to the death...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!999.X000.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!999.001!.dialogue_text: Other guards inspect the body of their fallen mage and shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. In clockwork unison, the warriors gather around Eidos. Wordlessly, they move, as though compelled by the unspoken directives of their slain commander, the flame of his instructions still burning brightly within them. Stone-faced, they begin their task, like a cadre of unthinking, unfeeling Neverborn automata.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!999.002!.dialogue_text: One of the soldiers then crouches down at her side to begin ruthlessly packing a band of cloth down her throat. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!999.003!.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!999.004!.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!999.005!.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!999.006!.dialogue_text: The warriors somberly sing a mournful dirge for their fallen leader as they witness Eidos' departure from the Falseflesh, knowing she will now go to do battle with Khlutt in the Graylands...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!0.0000!Q.dialogue_text: "Not been any entertainment here for quite some time; doubt it'll change anytime soon either..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!0.00000!.dialogue_text: "Really, if it's fanciful distractions you seek, you'd find better amusement in your dreams, I suppose. But life here's nothin' but a wakin' nightmare."

A.response_text: "Why stay? Why not defect to Tambul?"

D.response_text: "Perhaps I can be of service to you..."

E.response_text: "Such is the fate of the weak."

F.response_text: "My dreams are filled with violence and candy corn."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!0.0001!Q.dialogue_text: "Yes, yes. But child, I'm much too busy to be botherin' with whatever you're on about! I'm sure there're plenty of others who'd be willin' to help. "

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!0.X00010.dialogue_text: "So may Ark watch over you and Biracul lead you to your hearth and kin, outlander."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!0.800!QU.dialogue_text: "Look, child, no offense to you, but I've some work to do now."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!0.801!QU.dialogue_text: "All of us have a duty to attend to, and mine is this theater here."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!1.X000!Q.dialogue_text: "That Tambulan lad has got quite a voice on him, make no mistake!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!2.X001!Q.dialogue_text: "Things are never so bad that they can't get worse..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!3.000!QU.dialogue_text: "That Tambulan lad has got quite a voice on him, make no mistake!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!AMPHITHEATRE!3.X002!Q.dialogue_text: "Well, the less said the better, I suppose."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.X0000!DESC.dialogue_text:
Eidos now finds herself standing inside the Archives of the Dawn Fortress. Several black iron brackets house crystalline illuminators, though their meager light fades well below the hidden pinnacle of the vaulted ceiling. While a fair number of tomes line the shelves of this library, the dimensions of this space are far in excess of what would be required to hold such a humble quantity of work.

		The center of the chamber's floor is also marked by absence, a dirt-filled but otherwise empty, circular space having been fashioned into the stonework. Numerous milky crystals dot the earth within, all inert. It looks to be in preparation for some structure or decoration that was left unfinished.

		Eidos' entrance has aroused the attention of the Archive's sole occupant, a youthful lady with long, fiery hair tightly braided on top with the surplus cascading down upon her shoulders, framing her deep set eyes and prominent check bones. Her sharp countenance displays both a sense of ease as well as penetrating awareness.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.X001!DESCR.dialogue_text:
Eidos now finds herself standing inside the Archives of the Dawn Fortress. Black iron brackets house crystalline illuminators, though their meager light stretches well below the pinnacle of the vaulted ceiling high overhead. While a fair number of tomes line the shelves of this library, the dimensions of this space are far in excess of what would be required to hold such a humble quantity of work.

		The center of the chamber's floor is also marked by absence, a dirt-filled circular space having been fashioned into the stonework. Numerous milky crystals dot the earth within, all inert. It looks to be in preparation for an addition, structure or decoration that was left unfinished.

		Eidos' rather unexpected spelunking and flamboyant entrance have aroused the attention of the Archive's sole occupant, a youthful lady with long, fiery hair tightly braided on top with the surplus cascading down upon her shoulders, framing her deep set eyes and prominent check bones. Her sharp countenance displays both a look of surprise as well as indomitable serenity. She opens her mouth to speak...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.X002!DESCR.dialogue_text: Stepping into the chamber beyond, Eidos sees that she has re-entered the Dawn Fortress Archives. Against the backdrop of the dimly-lit, vaulted space, Logira stands staring wide-eyed at her arrival. Her sharp countenance displays both a look of surprise as well as indomitable serenity. She opens her mouth to speak...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.X003!DESCR.dialogue_text: The Tacribian guards step forward and roughly bind Eidos' hands with coarse lengths of cord. Leading her from the Archives, they seek to compel Eidos to make the long climb up to the top of the walls, then through the courtyard, and ending only upon arrival at the Gates of Dawn...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.X004!DESCR.dialogue_text:
Eidos now finds herself standing inside the Archives of the Dawn Fortress. Black iron brackets house crystalline illuminators, though their meager light stretches well below the pinnacle of the vaulted ceiling high overhead. While a fair number of tomes line the shelves of this library, the dimensions of this space are far in excess of what would be required to hold such a humble quantity of work.

		The center of the chamber's floor is also marked by absence, a dirt-filled circular space having been fashioned into the stonework. Numerous milky crystals dot the earth within, all inert. It looks to be in preparation for an addition, structure or decoration that was left unfinished.

		Eidos' rather unexpected return to the Falseflesh has aroused the attention of the Archive's sole occupant, a youthful lady with long, fiery hair tightly braided on top with the surplus cascading down upon her shoulders, framing her deep set eyes, now set ablaze by her rage. Choking back tears, she opens her mouth to speak...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Looking around these adumbral Archives, Eidos sees that there is a sizable fresco painted upon the wall, opposite the front entrance. While it is impossible to determine its age for certain, the art here looks relatively fresh, with vibrant colors visible even in the modest amber light.\n\n\t\tThe image is of an imposing silver tree with brilliant golden foliage. Its knotted roots are depicted as unfurling like white tendrils down into the tenebrous space beneath. An army of hideous skeletal creatures appear to be assailing the tree, though they are held at bay by a woman wielding a spear painted in a shimmering metallic green.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Looking up the base of the majestic tree, Eidos notes three distinct animals among its branches: a serpent, a crow and, curiously, a wolf. Rays of metallic gold and red are seen radiating from the tree, as though it itself were casting divine light.\n\n\t\tAbove this, Eidos sees one further image painted in an understated hand, as if an afterthought. Behind the scene a disembodied eye surveys all that is in and around the tree.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.002!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Casual viewing turns to scrutiny as Eidos sees yet another feature: at the base of the fresco is a metallic protrusion.\n\n\t\tHowever, upon reaching to touch it, Eidos feels the watchful eye of the Librarian right behind her. Eidos turns to face Logira only to find a great distance yet between them, bridged by a smoldering stare. It leaves little doubt that further tampering with the device will be met with... resistance, to say the least. Eidos feels compelled to cease her investigation of the switch for now and renews her exploration of the Archives.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.X003!DESCR.dialogue_text: Browsing around, Eidos spies an ancient tome related to combat - one appearing to have been translated into the modern tongue. Merely by viewing it, she commits it to memory.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.003!DESCRI.dialogue_text: No more tomes here seem to her worth committing to memory. From her cursory survey, however, it looks as though much of this Archives' work is concerned with the details of religion, history and accounts of war. These are the words of a folk both lost and resolute.\n\n\t\tLeafing through a few select tomes, Eidos notes that the religious texts speak of a removal from home, a loss of past and a confusion of meaning. Many of the prayers seem to belie a distinct sense of an unheeding and unsympathetic heaven. Salvation seems found in the tomes of warcraft, which speak of feats of heroism, cunning, and fellowship in the face of sacrifice. Laced throughout, is a profound sense of resentment at a betrayal that can never be forgiven.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!10.X000!DESC.dialogue_text: Logira reaches out and cups Eidos' cheeks in her hands.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!11.X000!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos turns from the shadowy Archives and walks back into the narrow passage whence she came. As she does so, she immediately hears the clanking of some hoary mechanism as it forces the panel of wall to begin sliding back into place behind her.\n\n\t\tCasting one final glance over her shoulder, her final view is of the fleeting silhouette Logira's face carves out in the amber light. As the portal completes its closure, Eidos is embraced by darkness once again. Her path set, there is nowhere to go now, but forward.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!15.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Before her words finish echoing throughout the expansive Archives, Logira has already begun to summon a dark and forbidden Techne.\n\n\t\tThe emerald haze surrounding her intensifies as it disassembles her Falseflesh, unraveling it into threads of pure energy. These luminescent tendrils absorb the essence of the crystalline illuminators and sparkle with a radiance brighter than the very sun. The incredible amount of energy required for this Techne saps every last shred of life from the room and all begins to wither until it crumbles away into brittle ash.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!15.001!DESCR.dialogue_text: In an instant, Eidos is enveloped by and interwoven with these life-sucking threads, until she and what was once the Librarian of Tacriba join in an indivisible mass of flesh and bones. It is fortunate for her that the agonizing pain lasts but a moment as Eidos' Trueflesh begins to rot away to its core, the complete and utter denial of existence. In a flash, nothing remains...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!15.002!DESCR.dialogue_text: Yet, in spite of her destruction, she is not without recourse, as Eidos is a divine child. Her mythic necessity ensures her persistence in the world, a deathless prisoner in perpetuity. The shattered pieces of her being are collected and will once more arise from the ashes into a new vessel for Thought made Form...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!19.X000!DESC.dialogue_text: Logira stands dejected and silent, her eyes an unveiled window to the smoldering anger in her heart. It is not long before the tense silence is broken by the swift clicking sound of hobnail sandals upon the stone steps outside the front entrance. The metal door is kicked open revealing the glowering visage of the Tacribian mage, a small force of his warriors in train. The amber light mockingly plays upon their blades, attacking her sensitive eyes as a prelude to the violence to come. In the span of a heartbeat, the unarmed leader approaches Eidos, bile dripping from the words his snarling mouth now seeks to spit.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0099.000!DES.dialogue_text: As Logira succumbs to her injuries, a look of proud determination falls upon a point behind Eidos. Turning about, she sees that summons unheard have called forth the master of this fortress. The sinewy frame of Khlutt, commander of the Tacribian League, now silently glides into the Archive.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0099.001!DES.dialogue_text: Moving with a feline grace, the click of the mage's hobnail sandals mark the time as he paces a circle about Eidos. His face has all the emotion and stability of a stone archway, yet unambiguously seeks the utter annihilation of this enemy of the Tacribian League...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!999.X000!DES.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!999.001!DESC.dialogue_text: Other guards inspect the body of their fallen mage and shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. In clockwork unison, the warriors gather around Eidos. Wordlessly, they move, as though compelled by the unspoken directives of their slain commander, the flame of his instructions still burning brightly within them. Stone-faced, they begin their task, like a cadre of unthinking, unfeeling Neverborn automata.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!999.002!DESC.dialogue_text: One of the soldiers then crouches down at her side to begin ruthlessly packing a band of cloth down her throat. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!999.003!DESC.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!999.004!DESC.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!999.005!DESC.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!999.006!DESC.dialogue_text: The warriors somberly sing a mournful dirge for their fallen leader as they witness Eidos' departure from the Falseflesh, knowing she will now go to do battle with Khlutt in the Graylands...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.000!KHLUTT.dialogue_text: "Outlander, how exactly you managed to resurrect the crystal across the Star Bridge baffles me, but the fact is you have."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.0000!KHLUT.dialogue_text: "Now you're left with two choices: exile into the Wasteland or death."

B.response_text: "What will happen now that the portcullis is open?"

D.response_text: "Is this how you usually repay your debts?"

E.response_text: "Exile is too good for you; only your death will do."

F.response_text: "Is this the bed-wetter you were talking about, Logi-chan?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.100!KHLUTT.dialogue_text: "Crime? Irrelevant. Your jinntouched meddling now benefits us, and we intend to stop it before it ceases to do so."

A.response_text: "You have no right to do this."

E.response_text: "The choice is obvious: your death benefits me most."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.200!KHLUTT.dialogue_text: "Justice will happen; the Dazirans will pay for their centuries of crimes against Tacribians!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.2000!KHLUT.dialogue_text: "Now, I need to ensure you don't interfere further. So choose: death or exile."

A.response_text: "You have no right to do this."

C.response_text: "Do as you like; it makes no difference to me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.400!KHLUTT.dialogue_text: "You are owed nothing by the Tacribian people."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.4000!KHLUT.dialogue_text: "All you have done is meddle with that which you do not understand and we benefited from your acting in truth-blindness."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.4002!KHLUT.dialogue_text: "Now I need to ensure you don't interfere further. So choose: death or exile."

C.response_text: "Do as you like; it makes no difference to me."

D.response_text: "Lucky you. Now your ineptitude will go unnoticed for a while longer..."

F.response_text: "Dismissive denial. Blaming others. Classic signs of a bed-wetter!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.101!KHLUTT.dialogue_text: "Then it seems you choose death; for out here, only might makes right, outlander."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.1010!KHLUT.dialogue_text: "You may pray to whatever gods you wish before your trip to the Graylands."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.1011!KHLUT.dialogue_text: "But don't worry; I'll be sending Khaa and all of Dazir to keep you company in the near future."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.2010!KHLUT.dialogue_text: "Tacribians! Exile her and the Daziran spy to the Wastes."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.2012!KHLUT.dialogue_text: "If those Kharrspawn will not give us water, then their blood will slake our thirst!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.301!KHLUTT.dialogue_text: "Then I will reward your apathy with the slow death of exile in the Wasteland."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.4010!KHLUT.dialogue_text: "I will soon control the entire region, you jinncursed fool!"

A.response_text: "You have no right to do this."

C.response_text: "Do as you like; it makes no difference to me."

D.response_text: "Oh, sagacious Khlutt! Teach me how to let my people die of thirst!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.501!KHLUTT.dialogue_text: "Then the Obsidian Jinn visits you today, Kharrspawn!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.5010!KHLUT.dialogue_text: "I will end your pathetic existence and rip your ghost from your Falseflesh!"

E.response_text: "You're gonna need more guards then, weakling."

A.response_text: "Buckle up, bladder blaster! By Roostor's comb, your bed-wetting days are over!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!10.000!KHLUT.dialogue_text: "I should think it strange you would die upon our soil and yet return as though unscathed..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!10.001!KHLUT.dialogue_text: "But I care not for your cheap parlor tricks and machinations; for the way to those spineless Kharrspawn is now clear and they will pay for their transgressions."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!10.002!KHLUT.dialogue_text: "As to what we do with you, well it's clear that the draug-brained belong only in the Wastes!"

E.response_text: "I will not go without a fight."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.000!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "Biracul bless you, outlander. I'm Logira, Librarian of the Tacribian people. To aid is my life and will."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.0000!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Though I must admit, I do find it puzzling that you would come to this fortress at such dire times."

A.response_text: "It's of your plight I wish to speak."

C.response_text: "I seem to have made a wrong turn somewhere."

D.response_text: "Perhaps I can be of service to your people..."

E.response_text: "I don't care about your problems. Just give me access to your records."

F.response_text: "That's why they call me 'the Puzzler'!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.001!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "I see... While our historical records are meager, I will do my best to accommodate your requests."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.0010!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "What is it you wish to know?"

A.response_text: "I would like to know more of the Tacribians."

B.response_text: "What is the nature of this Archive?"

E.response_text: "Why is this facility inferior to other libraries?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.100!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "Clearly, we are an armed and militarized clan of Kabu folk. What you may not know is that we have not always guarded lives with the point of a spear. In fact, we were once responsible for guarding knowledge."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.1000!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Generations ago, our primary function was to act as preservers and keepers of Vanquished lore. Such was our task as prescribed by Biracul at the founding."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.1001!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "However, after the destruction of the Sun Tower, the peoples of Kabu jointly decided to construct the Dawn Fortress, and chose us to protect it."

A.response_text: "Where did the Tacribians hail from originally?"

B.response_text: "Why was moving to the Dawn Fortress necessary?"

E.response_text: "And you only use this strength for defense?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.200!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "Traditionally, all Archives house many of the tomes left to us by our founder, Biracul. And many other works that came both prior and later."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.2000!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "You will forgive, I hope, the poverty of our humble offerings. While other townships are gifted with a Muninn Tree, we must be content with only hand-copied tomes."

A.response_text: "Where did the Tacribians hail from originally?"

D.response_text: "Why was moving to the Dawn Fortress necessary?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.X300!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "May you find whatever it is you seek. And may Ark guide you, outlander."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.500!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "You will find that the Dawn Fortress has been more concerned with records of the defense of the canyon from the Wasteland. Moreover, we lack the Muninn Tree that would serve as a living vessel for our wisdom. Hence our 'inferior facilities'..."

A.response_text: "Where did the Tacribians hail from originally?"

D.response_text: "Why was moving to the Dawn Fortress necessary?"

E.response_text: "So your folk are merely concerned with defense and not action."

F.response_text: "You don't believe me, do you!?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.X101!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "The edge of Jenowin Plain, just across the Crescent Canyon, though Old Tacriba now lies abandoned."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.1010!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "After the Jinnwraith and its draugnir horde attempted an assault on Tambul, it was deemed necessary to build a perimeter around Heaven's Bridge, to keep the Kharrspawn from crossing."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.1011!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "There are also accounts that there was an edict to strike the whereabouts of Old Tacriba from all records."

A.response_text: "Why did you abandon your old way of life?"

E.response_text: "Have you personally encountered these creatures?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.10100!LOGI.dialogue_text: "The edge of Jenowin Plain, just across the Crescent Canyon, though Old Tacriba now lies abandoned."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.10101!LOGI.dialogue_text: "After the Jinnwraith and its draugnir horde attempted an assault on Tambul, it was deemed necessary to build a perimeter around Heaven's Bridge, to keep the Kharrspawn from crossing."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.10102!LOGI.dialogue_text: "There are also accounts that there was an edict to strike the whereabouts of Old Tacriba from all records."

A.response_text: "I have been there. I even activated the portcullis."

E.response_text: "Have you personally encountered these creatures?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.10103!LOGI.dialogue_text: "You mean... the Star Bridge is accessible?!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.X101030!LO.dialogue_text: "This is... Oh, I don't have time for words!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.201!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "Heralding the coming of doom was the slaying of Elk, the first of the Muninn Trees of Kabu."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.2010!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "This sin was the setting of the sun for our home of Tacriba, but the Long Night would threaten us all."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.2011!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "When Ark cast the Jinnwraith was into the canyon, the Sun Tower and its gate were in ruins; and with only the Moon Tower to protect us, the Dazirans began construction of the Dawn Fortress to keep the draugnir horde from crossing Heaven's Bridge into Tambul."

A.response_text: "Why did you abandon your old way of life?"

D.response_text: "How did the draugnir have the means to destroy the tower?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.401!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "Look upon the shattered remains of the Sun Tower and you will see what nightmares drove us to build these walls..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.4010!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "The Wasteland promises the doom of our folk."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.4011!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "But the Dawn Fortress is not all, for 'Forewarned is forearmed'. So we have also built outposts within the Waste itself to warn us of coming draugnir assaults."

D.response_text: "How did the draugnir have the means to destroy the tower?"

E.response_text: "Have you personally encountered these creatures?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.501!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "The beginnings of the force that now commands the Dawn Fortress was a band of disciples under the warrior-mage Ark: the Valvorthr."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.5010!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "They were an offensive force by nature. However, after the draugnir raid on the Sun Tower, the duties of the Tacribian League were prescribed."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.5011!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Aggression, specifically aggression against Kabu, was explicitly prohibited."

A.response_text: "Why did you abandon your old way of life?"

D.response_text: "How did the draugnir have the means to destroy the tower?"

E.response_text: "Have you personally encountered these creatures?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.601!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "In actual fact, I find the epithet remarkably accurate."

F.response_text: "Roostor would be pleased... Now, I'm off to find the Jade Monkey!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.102!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "After the passing of Ark, Khloud was selected from among her Valvorthr to lead the Tacribians at the Dawn Fortress."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.1020!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "However, nothing has arisen in the centuries since that has tested this fortress."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.1021!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "So while the ruined tower stands as a constant reminder of the enemies this side of the canyon, Khlutt is focused on his personal enemies on the other side."

A.response_text: "Tell me more of the problems here."

E.response_text: "You are fools to let such power go unused."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.202!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "Not since the breaking of the Sun Tower have the draugnir shown themselves in any force - though it was a near thing that the draugnir were repelled in the first place."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.2020!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Ark was able to destroy the Jinnwraith commanding the draugnir. But nothing has arisen in the centuries since that has tested this fortress."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.2021!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "So while the ruined tower stands as a constant reminder of the enemies this side of the canyon, Khlutt is focused on his personal enemies on the other side."

A.response_text: "Tell me more of the problems here."

D.response_text: "How did the Jinnwraith attain its power?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.402!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "All we know for certain was that the Jinnwraith Rikharr traveled into the Waste, and when he returned, he worked the will of the Jinns upon us."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.4020!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "It is said that he met the Rubied Jinn on the road to Tacriba in the Jenowin plain. There he was given Glyphcraft to open a gate to the Graylands that would melt the foundations of the Sun Tower with jinnfire!"

D.response_text: "How did the Jinnwraith attain its power?"

E.response_text: "You are fools to let such power go unused."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.502!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "Yes, I have. All Tacribians are required to act as Rangers in the Wastes, especially aspiring Librarians and magi."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.5020!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "That's why I know first-hand how imperative it is that we not abandon our sacred charge to defend Kabu from the jinncursed abominations that ooze from the Stilled Sand Crater."

A.response_text: "Tell me more of the problems here."

D.response_text: "I wish to become more powerful than these horrors."

E.response_text: "You are fools to let such power go unused."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.2030!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "It's known that Vanquished relics dot the landscape. And at its heart is rumored to be the lost city of Ur'Ruk."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.2031!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "But the Wasteland is a grave for pillagers."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.2032!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Daziran artisans seeking ancient artifacts never return. There's no escaping the wraithglow."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.2033!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "History remembers only a handful of individuals that have entered the far Wastes and returned - and none have returned as heroes..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.403!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "Mastery of Techne is guarded in trust by magi and are only passed on upon death, usually to a Librarian like myself."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.4030!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "To know powers possessed by the Jinns, one must leave the confines of society. The reclusive mage Adarin is said to have done this."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.4031!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "I know not what one may find in the farthest reaches of the Wasteland. However, I do know that if you go, you won't return as one of us."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.503!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "You think such thoughts because you are truth-blind of our history and our ways, despite my best efforts to educate you."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.5030!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "But, I have no more time to waste."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.009!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "Excuse me, but I have no more time for conversation, as I must attend to my other duties."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.X0090!LOGI.dialogue_text: "You may explore the Archives and I hope find the answers you seek."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!0.010!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "I am sorry, but I have little time for further conversation while the fortress faces such dire troubles."

A.response_text: "It is of your plight I wish to speak."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.1000!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Our people have had a long-standing dispute with the folk of Dazir."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.10000!LOGI.dialogue_text: "While we accepted the role of fighting the fell jinnspawn of the Wastes, we have always been resentful of our dependence on Dazir for water."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.1001!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "A few days ago their mage leader, Khaa, stemmed the flow of the aqueduct. Without a source of fresh water, we will surely perish."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.1002!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "This is why Khlutt has set us on the misguided course of annihilating the Dazirans and claiming the aqueduct for ourselves."

A.response_text: "You sound as though you doubt this course."

E.response_text: "What are the chances of Tacribian victory?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.400!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "How could you aid us? You have no idea what Khlutt's designs are!"

D.response_text: "Perhaps you would be better off sulking?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.101!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "It's true, I have doubts about Khlutt's plans."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.1010!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Our people have no knowledge of Vanquished relics or their operation. So even if we managed to claim the aqueduct, we would be incapable of restoring the flow of water to the Dawn Fortress."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.1011!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "The whole sordid affair seems ill-advised and ill-fated, just a hasty reaction born from the perception of Dazir as the enemy..."

A.response_text: "You do not view them as the enemy?"

E.response_text: "Such thoughts are weak-hearted. Vengeance must be taken on one's enemies."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.2010!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Khaa hides behind his walls, refusing to explain and simply claiming the problem is 'being addressed'."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.2011!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "However, days pass and our water reserves dwindle, and all we can rely on are the meager handouts Tambul gives us."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.2012!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Now, Khlutt aims to cross the Crescent Canyon, to exterminate the Dazirans."

A.response_text: "The Dazirans seem clearly antithetical towards you."

C.response_text: "Perhaps it's best if I don't get involved."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.501!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "If Khlutt ever finds a means of traversing the canyon, his victory will be absolute."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.5010!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "However, Pakahron commands the Moon Tower on the far side and Khlutt has no means of penetrating the gate defending it."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.5011!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "So unless that gate is deactivated or an alternate route discovered, we Tacribians will be doomed to a death of thirst."

A.response_text: "The Dazirans seem clearly antithetical towards you."

D.response_text: "What are Khlutt's plans?"

E.response_text: "Such thoughts are weak-hearted! Enemies must be destroyed at any cost."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.102!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "I... have come to know the Daziran people."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.1020!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "While many of them are indeed arrogant, they truly are masters of the most ancient and sacred of trades. No mage wouldn't be in awe of the aqueduct they maintain."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.1021!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "And while I find Khaa deplorable, I would not slaughter the innocent for the crimes of one man."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.1022!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "However, Khlutt does not see them this way."

A.response_text: "Is there no one Khlutt will answer to?"

E.response_text: "If you had courage, you would challenge him."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.202!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "I don't know the details of Khlutt's reasoning, nor do I know how he plans to cross."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.2020!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "He has never felt the need to share his logic with others, as most of the guardians here obey without question."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.2021!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Moreover, his mental defenses are much stronger than the other magi of the region, leaving his plans as inscrutable as even the Unseen."

A.response_text: "Is there no one he will answer to?"

D.response_text: "How can I become a master of such power?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.402!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "He feels no need to share his plans with others, as most every Tacribian obeys without question."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.4020!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Moreover, his mental defenses are much stronger than the other magi of the region, leaving his inner thoughts as inscrutable as even the Unseen."

D.response_text: "Such power! How did he master these skills?"

E.response_text: "If you had courage, you would challenge Khlutt."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.5020!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "The Dazirans have awareness that is necessary; they truly are masters of the ancient knowledge passed on from the Vanquished."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.5021!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "And while I find their mage deplorable, I would not slaughter the innocent for the crimes of one man."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.5022!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Yet, Khlutt does not share this opinion."

A.response_text: "Is there no one he will answer to?"

D.response_text: "Such power! How did he master these skills?"

E.response_text: "If you had courage, you would challenge Khlutt."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.103!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "Khlutt has no confidants, as he considers none to be his peers."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.1030!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "No, instead he only knows and respects strength - and none in Kabu can match his command of Technocraft."

A.response_text: "We will find a way to bring peace to Kabu, Logira."

B.response_text: "I suspect there is more to this; I shall investigate further."

E.response_text: "You fools can fix this mess yourselves."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.503!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "Your truth-blindness to our ways is expected, so I will tell you that Librarians are bound by Tacribian law against challenging their mage."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.5030!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "If I were to violate this custom, I would be guilty of the same hypocrisy as Khlutt."

A.response_text: "I will find a way to bring peace, no matter the cost."

D.response_text: "Then this place is lost, and I'd rather not ally myself to the losing party."

E.response_text: "You fools can fix this mess yourselves."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!1.1050!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Nonetheless, I thank you for your kind words in this time of darkness."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!2.000!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "I'm sorry, outlander, but I have to meditate on the words of Biracul and Ark to try to find an answer."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!2.X001!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "May Ark keep you from the wraithglow."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!9.000!LOGIRA.dialogue_text: "You have spoken your piece, and I mine."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!10.000!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "How did you...? But... The Star Bridge... should be blocked..."

D.response_text: "...And so it remains; I lowered the portcullis after walking through."

E.response_text: "Not blocked to the likes of me."

F.response_text: "No barrier can bar the scion of Roostor! I am unbar-able!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!10.001!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "...I saw your Falseflesh burned, and yet undead you return... But worse still you come through a long-dead gate."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!10.0010!LOGI.dialogue_text: "What dark and sinister Techne is this?!"

D.response_text: "...And so it remains. I lowered the portcullis after walking through."

E.response_text: "Not even death deters me; what could a measly portcullis do?"

F.response_text: "Neither death nor doors can bar the scion of Roostor!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!10.002!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "...Then the blood of our mage was not enough to sate the Rubied Jinn?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!10.0020!LOGI.dialogue_text: "Of course it wasn't, not even hundreds of years of preying on us has quenched your thirst!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!10.0021!LOGI.dialogue_text: "But today it ends; and our people will suffer no more at your hands, Famlaz!"

A.response_text: "I spilled your mage's blood, true, but I am not the Rubied Jinn!"

D.response_text: "Now don't do anything rash! Surely we can come to some agreement!"

E.response_text: "Not even death deters me; what could you possibly hope to do?"

F.response_text: "That desert bird dude is just a Roostor wannabe!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!10.101!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "With the Star Bridge reactivated, nothing can stop Khlutt."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!10.300!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Argh! Jinncursed outlander, I'll find out what I need to know for myself!"

D.response_text: SUR

E.response_text: TYR

F.response_text: LOO

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!11.000!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Listen carefully, Eidos, because I don't have much time!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!11.002!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "If he attacks Dazir, none will survive."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!11.003!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Now, only you can prevent this, Eidos!"

B.response_text: "I have no reason to trust you."

E.response_text: "The approval of weaklings means nothing to me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!11.100!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "No! If he is unwilling to negotiate with his own people, what makes you think he would hear the jinnwhispered words of a foreigner?!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!11.101!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "The second you knocked on that wall, he knew you were here and he now comes to bind you!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!11.102!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Help me restore peace; don't just stand back and watch everyone die! Please, for the love of Ark!"

B.response_text: "I want to know more, but for now I accept."

E.response_text: "Perhaps I will join your master in his crusade."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!11.1031!LOGI.dialogue_text: "After crossing the Star Bridge, you must close the portcullis! Extract the energy from the crystal and it will close."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!11.1032!LOGI.dialogue_text: "Then, enter the Wellspring and find my friend, Quangjo. He is there already, to release the water, but it has been a few days since we last met, and I fear the worst."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!11.1033!LOGI.dialogue_text: "You cannot return here, for soon you and I will have no friends in the Dawn Fortress, as I will be severely punished for my betrayal."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!11.X301!LOGI.dialogue_text: "I am... disappointed, outlander... and can only hope that it is the inscrutable will of the Shining One."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!12.000!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Listen carefully, Eidos, because I don't have much time!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!12.001!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Our water supply dwindles by the hour because the water from the Wellspring no longer flows to our fortress."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!12.002!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Khaa assures us it is being taken care of, but Khlutt maintains it was intentional and he demands the Dazirans pay for it with their lives."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!12.003!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "The truth behind everything must lie in the Wellspring itself!"

B.response_text: "I have no reason to trust you."

C.response_text: "I don't want to get involved in this."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!12.200!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "There is no time for you to be appraised of all the details, because Khlutt already heads for the Archives as we speak!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!12.201!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "The second you knocked on that wall, he knew you were here and he now comes to bind you!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!12.202!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Help me restore peace; don't just stand back and watch everyone die! Please, for the love of Ark!"

B.response_text: "I want to know more, but for now I accept."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!13.000!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Listen carefully, Eidos, because I don't have much time!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!13.001!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "You may not have done this intentionally, but your jinnstruck actions have messed everything up."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!13.002!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Please help me fix what you've broken!"

B.response_text: "I want to know more, but for now I accept."

C.response_text: "I don't want to get involved in this."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!13.301!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Because of what you have done, people will die!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!13.302!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Now help me restore peace; don't just stand back and watch everyone die! Please, for the love of Ark!"

B.response_text: "Then, I will undo what I have done."

D.response_text: "What makes you think your master won't reward me for my aid..?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!14.000!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Listen carefully, Eidos, because I don't have much time!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!14.001!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "If you want to survive, you cannot confront Khlutt!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!14.002!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "You must go back across the Star Bridge and seal off the way; and afterwards, restore the flow of water to the Dawn Fortress; or else neither you nor the Dazirans will see the rising of another moon!"

C.response_text: "I don't want to get involved in this."

D.response_text: "What makes you think your master won't reward me for my aid..?"

E.response_text: "The approval of weaklings means nothing to me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!14.401!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "You'd more likely receive the truth from the Rubied Jinn!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!14.402!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "You will be lucky if Khlutt 'rewards' you with exile instead of death!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!14.403!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Please, I beg you! Help me restore peace, for the love of Ark!"

D.response_text: "...You have a friend in me, Logira."

E.response_text: "Even Death trembles at my name; your master will fare no better."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!15.000!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Listen carefully, Eidos, because I don't have much time!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!15.001!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "You may think yourself strong, but even you cannot stand up to Khlutt!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!15.002!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "But the Wellspring has forbidden Techne not even the legendary mage Wulfias could fully contain!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!15.003!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "If you enter there and find it, you can also restore the flow of water and help to fix this catastrophe!"

A.response_text: "Calm down! I'll just talk him out of it."

D.response_text: "What makes you think your master won't reward me for my aid..?"

E.response_text: "The approval of weaklings means nothing to me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!15.501!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "My master could cripple you with a mere thought and he draws nearer and nearer by the instant!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!15.502!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Now either help me restore peace or pray to whatever gods you may believe in, for you will never again see the moon rise in the east, foreigner!"

D.response_text: "...You have a friend in me, Logira."

E.response_text: "Even Death trembles at my name; your master will fare no better."

F.response_text: "Eghads woman! Out with it!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!16.002!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Well, you see... I really need your help and..."

F.response_text: "Buck buck buckwayk! The Feathered One?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!ARCHIVES!16.600!LOGIR.dialogue_text: "Yes, and he needs you to go save him... Or he said he'd send Khlutt to kill you!"

A.response_text: "In that case, I will help you."

F.response_text: "You can't fire me, I quit!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!0.X000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Myriad forgotten steps bring the her to living quarters. Here, the midday sun desperately tries to creep in through thin surveillance slits in the walls - though the persistent rays find only limited success, as these barracks seem to mirror the reserved and guarded Tacribians who built them.\n\n\t\tA silent stillness rules over this place, as midday is no time for a warrior to be idle, it seems. However, in a far corner, there look to be three occupants engaged in conversation so quiet that Eidos failed to notice their presence until this very moment.

D.response_text: Eavesdrop on the conversation

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!0.X001!DESCR.dialogue_text: Eidos cautiously walks closer to the voices, first close enough for the sounds to coalesce into isolated words, finally advancing until the words form intelligible sentences. She pauses.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!0.X002!DESCR.dialogue_text: The exit to the exterior leads back to the Proving Grounds and the Courtyard. However, looking around it is clear that there is another chamber adjacent to this one within the barracks itself. An overhanging sign depicts the following message: 'Gymnasium: Let none who are truth-blind of the Arts of War pass this threshold.'

A.response_text: Go outside to the Proving Grounds

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!0.002!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Looking in the direction of the mage's abode, she sees the doors are barred shut, leaving the courtyard the only logical destination.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!1.X000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Their conversation concluded, the warrior trio disbands in the six directions. As such, there seems little else to do in this area. Though she could return to the Courtyard whence she came, looking around it is clear that there is another chamber adjacent to this one within the barracks itself. An overhanging sign depicts the following message: 'Gymnasium: Let none who are truth-blind of the Arts of War pass this threshold.'

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!1.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Their conversation concluded, the warrior trio disbands in the six directions. As such, there seems little else to do in this area. Looking in the direction of the mage's abode, she sees the doors are barred shut, leaving the courtyard the only logical destination.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.X000!DESCR.dialogue_text: At this time of day, the barracks are as empty as the words of a Jinn and as silent as Melinoe herself. As such, there seems little else to do in this area. Though she could return to the Courtyard whence she came, looking around it is clear that there is another chamber adjacent to this one within the barracks itself. An overhanging sign depicts the following message: 'Gymnasium: Let none who are truth-blind of the Arts of War pass this threshold.'

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: At this time of day, the barracks are as empty as the words of a Jinn and as silent as Melinoe herself. As such, there seems little else to do in this area. Looking in the direction of the mage's abode, she sees the doors are barred shut, leaving the courtyard the only logical destination.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!0099.000!DES.dialogue_text: Before the Tacribian warrior can succumb to injuries, a look of proud determination falls upon a point behind Eidos. Turning about, she sees that summons unheard have called forth the master of this fortress. The sinewy frame of Khlutt, commander of the Tacribian League, now silently glides into the Barracks.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!0099.001!DES.dialogue_text: Moving with a feline grace, the click of the mage's hobnail sandals mark the time as he paces a circle about her. His face has all the emotion and stability of a stone archway, yet unambiguously promises a destruction utter and absolute...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!999.X000!DES.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!999.001!DESC.dialogue_text: Other guards inspect the body of their fallen mage and shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. In clockwork unison, the warriors gather around Eidos. Wordlessly, they move, as though compelled by the unspoken directives of their slain commander, the flame of his instructions still burning brightly within them. Stone-faced, they begin their task, like a cadre of unthinking, unfeeling Neverborn automata.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!999.002!DESC.dialogue_text: One of the soldiers then crouches down at her side to begin ruthlessly packing a band of cloth down her throat. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!999.003!DESC.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!999.004!DESC.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!999.005!DESC.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!999.006!DESC.dialogue_text: The warriors somberly sing a mournful dirge for their fallen leader as they witness Eidos' departure from the Falseflesh, knowing she will now go to do battle with Khlutt in the Graylands...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!0.X000!DIYA!.dialogue_text: "It's a bitter wind blowing from the Wastes these past eves... I like it not."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!0.X000!IMAT!.dialogue_text: "What would you expect? The Wastewinds are always as fell as Rikharr's stinking arse, these nights or any other, from before the beginning."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!0.000!XERK!.dialogue_text: "So you're a deedscribe now, are you, Imat? Perhaps Logira will have a challenger soon!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!0.X000!XERK!.dialogue_text: "It's for the best Diya steers clear of the Wastes, though. Ranging ill-suits him, older than Ark as he is..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!0.001!IMAT!.dialogue_text: "I'll have your silence, Xerk! What Diya says with his fretting you say with your jibes."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!0.X001!IMAT!.dialogue_text: "We're all worried about Shen. But there's nothing we can do for him now."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!0.001!DIYA!.dialogue_text: "Look, Shen's disappearance is only the latest in a series of jinnborn horrors!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!0.0010!DIYA!.dialogue_text: "That draugnir Fwayya and her Shariken tracked from Land's End into the Salt Forest during her last circuit begs the question of how in Ark's name it got beyond the Beacon in the first place!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!0.0011!DIYA!.dialogue_text: "And what's more, where they found it oughta be beyond the wraithglow, but Fwayya nearly fell to it - would've too, if it hadn't been for Shen's sacrifice."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!0.X0012!DIYA.dialogue_text: "And if that's not enough, I myself heard voices and jinnwhispers on the air some nights ago..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!1.000!XERK!.dialogue_text: "Ha! Voices! Don't let Khlutt hear you say that; he doesn't look favorably upon those who hit the Jinn-liquor while on watch."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!1.001!XERK!.dialogue_text: "But if you're really so curious, then why don't we do a little investigating of our own..?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!1.X002!XERK!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps we'll find Shen while we're at it..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!1.000!IMAT!.dialogue_text: "Neither of you jinnlickers are going anywhere you're not instructed to go."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!1.001!IMAT!.dialogue_text: "Fwayya was bound by duty to leave her Shariken in the Salt Forest; and she had the wisdom to follow through. A true Tacribian she is!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!1.002!IMAT!.dialogue_text: "Our wills are deferred to the League for the good of the League, and don't you forget it!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!1.X003!IMAT!.dialogue_text: "Besides, you two have neither the right nor the wit to undertake your own draug-brained scheme to rescue Shen."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.000!XERK!.dialogue_text: "I'm not worried about Shen; he can take care of himself!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.X000!XERK!.dialogue_text: "Fact is, he might be safer out there than us within the fort, if that Kharrspawn Khaa has his way..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.000!DIYA!.dialogue_text: "You don't know what you're talking about, pup!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.002!DIYA!.dialogue_text: "Never seen the wraithglow of the Forest or what it does to a ranger... I'd not even wish it on a jinnlickin' Daziran!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.003!DIYA!.dialogue_text: "You've never been in view of the Stilled Sand Crater at Ark's Beacon and seen those wandering draugnir... staring back at you from across the fields of icesand with their eyes, blacker than the Obsidian Ruin..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.001!XERK!.dialogue_text: "No, I haven't. But I have seen what a day's thirst can do to a strong ranger within these walls!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.0010!XERK!.dialogue_text: "But, maybe you're right. Maybe all the draugnir are about to descend on us led by the Obsidian Jinn herself."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.0012!XERK!.dialogue_text: "Because if we don't take care of Dazir and the Wellspring soon, all the draugnir will find is a fortress full of parched corpses!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.001!IMAT!.dialogue_text: "You've sworn your blood-oath to obey your mage!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.X002!IMAT!.dialogue_text: "If Khlutt says to go find Shen, we range; if he says to kill all the people of Kabu, we fight; if he says to linger here and perish by thirst or slaughter, we wither."

A.response_text: "There can be no victory without order."

B.response_text: "Excuse me, do any of you know about the Lost City of Ur'Ruk?"

D.response_text: "This Khlutt sounds like a powerful man..."

E.response_text: "I thought you were warriors, not slaves."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.003!IMAT!.dialogue_text: "If Khlutt says to go find Shen, we range; if he says to kill all the people of Kabu, we fight; if he says to linger here and perish by thirst or slaughter, we wither."

A.response_text: "There can be no victory without order."

B.response_text: "Excuse me, do any of you know about the Lost City of Ur'Ruk?"

D.response_text: "Actually, Biracul said you should call your own shots."

E.response_text: "I thought you were warriors, not slaves."
"You heard me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.200!IMAT!.dialogue_text: "Go to the Archives if you wish to know of the Wasteland without braving it yourself!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.400!IMAT!.dialogue_text: "I'm sure he does sound that way... even to a conceited foreigner who knows nothing of our ways."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.500!IMAT!.dialogue_text: "If I wanted the opinion of weaklings, I'd go ask that Daziran coward hanging in the courtyard..."

E.response_text: "I'm surprised an idiot like you is even capable of human speech."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.101!IMAT!.dialogue_text: "You were speaking like... someone else for a moment."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.1010!IMAT!.dialogue_text: "Thank you stranger; I'm glad you agree."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.401!IMAT!.dialogue_text: "Go somewhere else to peddle your outsider interpretations of Biracul!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.4010!IMAT!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps you and that false prophet can form some kind of unholy union."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!BARRACKS!2.501!IMAT!.dialogue_text: "Move along, stranger... Killing you would just bring shame upon my blades..."

E.response_text: "Make me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!CAVERN!0.000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Moving forward from the bridge, Eidos enters a darkened cavern. In the meager sunlight illuminating the mouth of the entrance, it becomes clear that this passage must be artificial. The aperture is a nearly perfect semi-circle carved from the rock and arching support structures added. What's more, two timeworn ruts line the otherwise smooth floor, indicating that this passage once bore some kind of wheeled vehicle.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!CAVERN!0.0001!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: As she continues down the cavern, what little light the sun could inject dies away completely, forcing her to run her hand along the wall for a sense of direction. She walks through the passage for hours on end, taking her further and further into the northeast.\n\n\t\tIn time, she finds another illuminated point, two small crystalline sconces casting their soft, amber light. It is the termination of this passage. Her Eidos finds the ruined remains of an ancient cart, its wooden wheels and frame long-since dissolved to dust leaving only the metal spokes and rims to hint at its former design.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!CAVERN!0.0002!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: The far wall here is composed of stonework unlike her surroundings. While the passage has been cut directly from the limestone, dark sandstone bricks form the wall obstructing her progress. They have been cut and fitted together with uncanny skill, requiring no mortar between the blocks.

C.response_text: Search for a way to pass

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!CAVERN!0.001!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Searching high and low, left and right, Eidos neither spots nor feels a way to pass by this wall.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!CAVERN!0.1010!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Knocking softly at first, even Eidos struggles to hear the faint sounds her fists make on the cold bricks. Soon, she finds herself violently hammering at the sandstone, yelling in concert with the dull thud of her aching hands. Though this mad effort only elevates her volume above barely audible. It would be a miracle if anyone heard her on the other side of this thick and unwelcoming wall. And thus, she ceases her futile wailing.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!CAVERN!0.10100!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Turning around to begin her trek back, she hears what sounds like a clicking sound from behind the barrier. Suddenly, the heavy slab is lifted by an all but soundless and unseen force. The chamber beyond is a stark contrast to underground passage. It is a large hall illuminated by the golden light of crystals suspended high upon its dark walls.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!CAVERN!0.10101!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Having been at length deprived of decent lighting, those beams pouring forth from beyond the wall violently blind Eidos. Then, the silhouette of a feminine figure cuts through these troublesome rays. Hand outstretched, it seems to now silently beckon her.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!CAVERN!0.1011!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Eidos pounds with ever-escalating intensity on the sandstone's bricks, filling the caverns with the echoes of her violent hails, only yielding the same levels of barely audible effect through the thick and unwelcoming walls. Yet, there is no response to Eidos' knock this time. This path is closed and she must now proceed through the cavern in order to fulfill her promise to Logira.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!CAVERN!0.1012!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Eidos pounds with ever-escalating intensity on the sandstone's bricks, filling the caverns with the echoes of her violent hails, only yielding pitiful levels of barely audible effect through the thick and unwelcoming walls. Yet, the silence with which her calls are met stands in mocking contrast. She has no choice but to turn from the cold stone and make her way back down the tunnel.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!CAVERN!0.1013!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Knocking softly at first, even Eidos struggles to hear the faint sounds her fists make on the cold bricks. Soon, she finds herself violently hammering at the sandstone, yelling in concert with the dull thud of her aching hands. Though this mad effort only elevates her volume above barely audible. It would be a miracle if anyone heard her on the other side of this thick and unwelcoming wall. And thus, she ceases her futile wailing.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!CAVERN!0.10130!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Turning around to begin her trek back, she hears what sounds like a clicking sound from behind the barrier. Suddenly, the heavy slab is lifted by an all but soundless and unseen force. The chamber beyond is a stark contrast to underground passage. It is a large hall illuminated by the golden light of crystals suspended high upon its dark walls.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!CAVERN!0.10131!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Having been at length deprived of decent lighting, those beams pouring forth from beyond the wall violently blind Eidos. Then, the silhouette of a feminine figure cuts through these troublesome rays. Though impossible to determine the exact contour of its features, Eidos senses aggression, anger and sadness as she passes through the portal and into the light.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!CAVERN!11.000!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Stepping through the doorway, Eidos stands in a cavern lit mostly by the dim crystal lights of the Archives, save two pitiful auxiliary crystalline sconces making their best effort to contribute with their meager offerings of light. Before her are the ruined remains of cart and a track leading into complete darkness.\n\n\t\tAs the Archives door closes, it takes with it the brightness they cast upon the dank cavern. Knowing that the Archives are now a thing of the past, Eidos can only return to the bridge.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.X001!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos now enters a vast, open area, small dust devils whirling up here and there, vanishing just as quickly as they appeared. While the environment is bounded by the titanic exterior wall, the most notable feature is in fact the massive, black iron gate and its retinue of Tacribian guards. With the exception of the warriors that stand silent vigil at this imposing portal, most of the people that are here seem to be busy and in transit to other areas.\n\n\t\tThe other remarkable landmark are the rows of cages at the center of the courtyard's dusty stone floor, not too far from a raised platform. Despite having numerous cages, Eidos can only spot a single prisoner: a turquoise-robed man gesticulating his silent soliloquy. An armed Tacribian is nearby, attending the small prison.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.0010!DESC.dialogue_text: The dialogue now concluded, Eidos considers what she will do next...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.X002!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos now enters a vast, open area, small dust devils whirling up here and there, vanishing just as quickly as they appeared. While the environment is bounded by the titanic exterior wall, the most notable feature is in fact the massive, black iron gate and its retinue of Tacribian guards. With the exception of the warriors that stand silent vigil at this imposing portal, most of the people that are here seem to be busy and in transit to other areas.\n\n\t\tThe other remarkable landmark are the rows of cages at the center of the courtyard's dusty stone floor, not too far from a raised platform. Despite having numerous cages, Eidos can only spot a single prisoner, one whose endless monologues she remembers all too well. An armed Tacribian is nearby, attending the small prison.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.002!DESCR.dialogue_text: The dialogue now concluded, Eidos considers what she will do next...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.X003!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos now enters a vast, open area, small dust devils whirling up here and there, vanishing just as quickly as they appeared. While the environment is bounded by the titanic exterior wall, the most notable feature is in fact the massive, black iron gate and its retinue of Tacribian guards. With the exception of the warriors that stand silent vigil at this imposing portal, most of the people that are here seem to be busy and in transit to other areas.\n\n\t\tThe other remarkable landmark are the rows of cages at the center of the courtyard's dusty stone floor, not too far from a raised platform. Despite having numerous cages, Eidos can only spot two individuals sitting within their cages: a turquoise-robed man she does not recognize and a man more known to her... Dysmas of Tambul, thief of the Moon Tower. There is also an armed Tacribian attending the small prison.

C.response_text: Speak to one of the prisoners

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.X004!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos now enters a vast, open area, small dust devils whirling up here and there, vanishing just as quickly as they appeared. While the environment is bounded by the titanic exterior wall, the most notable feature is in fact the massive, black iron gate and its retinue of Tacribian guards. With the exception of the warriors that stand silent vigil at this imposing portal, most of the people that are here seem to be busy and in transit to other areas.\n\n\t\tThe other remarkable landmark are the rows of cages at the center of the courtyard's dusty stone floor, not too far from a raised platform. Despite having numerous cages, Eidos can see two individuals sitting within their cages: the loquacious scholar Heyar and the thief of the Moon Tower Dysmas. There is also an armed Tacribian attending the small prison.

C.response_text: Speak to one of the prisoners

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.0040!DESC.dialogue_text: The dialogue now concluded, Eidos considers what she will do next...

C.response_text: Speak to one of the prisoners

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.101!DESCR.dialogue_text: Looking around, Eidos sees a number of locations that are connected to the courtyard. Aside from the black metal gate, Eidos can see a sand pit not far off. It looks as though there are people engaged in calisthenics and combat training there. Likewise, the passing of warriors both to and from a low building near the wall suggests the location of a barracks structure.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!77.X000!DES.dialogue_text: The mage of the Dawn Fortress stands alert - though eerily calm - before them. Though seemingly just an old and sinewy man, his eyes speak volumes of the unspeakable atrocities he has witnessed. Those eyes merely gaze at her, but Eidos stares back, paralyzed by her own animal instincts. Her muscles continuously tighten like an endless spasm. Pain robs her of her ability to think clearly, until the very moment the mage relaxes his scowl, releasing her from the trance. Every ounce of her relaxes simultaneously; she falls, kneeling as if subservient before the dour mage. Confident in his victory from this initial confrontation, he deigns to speak.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!77.X001!DES.dialogue_text: Khlutt begins to glide effortlessly towards Eidos and before she can react, a barrage of seemingly invisible blows of meteoric momentum descend upon her. She did not sense the use of any Techne as he pummels her into a state of harmless confusion. Losing all control, Eidos slumps to the ground, aware but broken.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!77.001!DESC.dialogue_text: Khlutt begins to glide effortlessly towards Eidos and before she can react, a barrage of seemingly invisible blows of meteoric momentum descend upon her. She did not sense the use of any Techne as he pummels her into a state of harmless confusion. Losing all control, Eidos slumps to the ground, aware but broken.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!78.000!DESC.dialogue_text: Time seems to slow as Eidos becomes aware of a Glyph begging to be drawn from the ether. Volatile, corrosive, promising complete annihilation of any who stand in its way. But Eidos barely manages to contain the urge - however temporary said containment might be.

E.response_text: Unleash its fury upon Khlutt

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!77.X002!DES.dialogue_text: The world spins around in her eyes, making it impossible to focus on what her malefactor now does. All she can tell from the blurred images reaching her is that Khlutt walks towards her with some bizarre device.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!77.003!DESC.dialogue_text: She feels its cold metal fingers of the artifact dig into her scalp.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!77.005!DESC.dialogue_text: That gut-churning, volatile sensation, like having fingernails pulled out from their root.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!77.006!DESC.dialogue_text: An emerald hue. A child's scream. A lack.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!77.X007!DES.dialogue_text: Eidos is no longer whole, though not even the memory of what she lost remains. All she knows now is that this man is very dangerous.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!77.008!DESC.dialogue_text:
The Tacribian warriors cheer in unison, echoing their mage's final words. But then, as a well oiled machine, they immediately disperse to execute their functions.

		Two men stay behind to collect the defeated Eidos and a caged Daziran, and then, rather unceremoniously, march them to the gates.

		Eidos and the other prisoner are soon thrust out onto the burning sands at spearpoint. The gate begins to close begrudgingly, groans of iron on iron voicing its complaints...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0099.000!DE.dialogue_text: Before the Tacribian warrior can succumb to injuries, a look of proud determination falls upon a point behind Eidos. Turning about, she sees that summons unheard have called forth the master of this fortress. The sinewy frame of Khlutt, commander of the Tacribian League, now silently glides into the Courtyard.

Several fearlessly step forward to restrain her, soon realizing that her own body, acting as ally to her enemies, has already done them this favor. Eidos helplessly watches as they bind her hands and feet with coarse ropes that scrape her skin raw.

In clockwork unison, the warriors gather around Eidos. Stone-faced, they begin their task, like a cadre of unthinking, unfeeling Neverborn automata.

With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!999.005!DES.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!999.006!DES.dialogue_text: The warriors somberly sing a mournful dirge for their fallen leader as they witness Eidos' departure from the Falseflesh, knowing she will now go to do battle with Khlutt in the Graylands...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.X000!DES.dialogue_text: Eidos awakens. She jerks into motion, but coarse ropes leave painful abrasions as they mercilessly writhe around her wrists and ankles. As far as she can tell, she is now inside a cage in the middle of a dust-covered courtyard with high sandstone walls for as far as the eye can see.\n\n\t\tAll around, the pungent smell of burning flesh permeates the air. Dead bodies are lined up about the courtyard, their hapless handlers just as dead of spirit as the bodies they throw into the fires.
