The only perceptible signs of life in this city of the walking dead come in the form of ritual incantations and solemn dirges from around the violent and unrelenting roar of the great pyres.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.000!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos awakens. She jerks into motion, but coarse ropes leave painful abrasions as they mercilessly writhe around her wrists and ankles. As far as she can tell, she is now inside a cage in the middle of the Dawn Fortress courtyard. Not far from her, the familiar form of Heyar reclines in one of the corners.\n\n\t\tAll around, the pungent smell of burning flesh permeates the air. Dead bodies are lined up about the courtyard, their hapless handlers just as dead of spirit as the bodies they throw into the fires. The only perceptible signs of life in this city of the walking dead come in the form of ritual incantations and solemn dirges from around the violent and unrelenting roar of the great pyres.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.X0010!DE.dialogue_text: At Eidos' stirring, her fellow prisoner scuttles away like a frightened rabbit. But then an epiphany dawns on him, a realization that now he will have more than just himself to talk to - or talk at? Indeed, a euphoric wash of emotion nearly knocks the ghost clear from his Falseflesh. Then, attempting to correct his posture and feign an air of dignity and composure, the gearwork of his jaw starts to wind up until its inevitable and interminable unwinding at the infelicitous opening of his mouth...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!92.X000!DES.dialogue_text: A rhythmic pounding abruptly echoes throughout the courtyard. Eidos looks up to see a regimented procession advancing into the courtyard. Led by a cadre of drummers, a line of individuals walks towards a central dais. At the line’s head is a muscular, yet ancient man, with a young but stately lady following close in train.\n\n\t\tThe guard standing nearby turns and begins unlocking the cage. Before long, several guards reach in and take Eidos to kneel before the dais.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!92.000!DESC.dialogue_text: A rhythmic pounding abruptly echoes throughout the courtyard. Eidos looks up to see a regimented procession advancing into the courtyard. Led by a cadre of drummers, a line of individuals walks towards a central dais. At the line’s head is a muscular, yet ancient man, with a young but stately lady following close in train.\n\n\t\tThe guard standing nearby turns and begins unlocking the cage. Before long, several guards reach in and take Eidos to kneel before the dais.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!92.X001!DES.dialogue_text: The old man and his attendants sit upon the platform as the woman approaches Eidos. She takes a place standing close by and slowly, she reaches out a hand, placing it upon the crown of Eidos' head. The drumming ceases, and the man begins to speak.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!92.X0010!DE.dialogue_text: The man and his attendants sit upon the platform as the woman approaches Eidos. She takes a place standing close by and slowly, she reaches out a hand, placing it upon the crown of Eidos' head. The drumming ceases, and the man begins to speak.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!92.X0011!DE.dialogue_text: Eidos swiftly calls to mind the Glyph of the Occult to obfuscate her thoughts, right before the Tacribian mage speaks...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!93.001!DESC.dialogue_text: As the words leave Eidos' lips, a sudden, stabbing pain cracks open her mind.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!93.002!DESC.dialogue_text: Flashes of white and black. A dizzying sense of displacement.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!93.003!DESC.dialogue_text: Images once blurred take form. Thoughts once muddy gain clarity.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!93.004!DESC.dialogue_text: Unwillingly, Eidos sees herself upon the metallic platform of the Sanctuary's Awakening Chamber.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!93.005!DESC.dialogue_text: Involuntarily, an indistinct whimper escapes her throat.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!93.X006!DES.dialogue_text: Inexorably, her name bubbles to the surface of her consciousness and out through the mouth of the woman whose hand now robs her mind of privacy...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!94.000!DESC.dialogue_text: Khlutt nods his head and turns to leave. The drummers strike their instruments, as a guard unlocks the cage behind her, extracting a bound Heyar from it. The two are led wordlessly to the threshold, the ponderous drumming of Khlutt's attendants the only sound breaking the otherwise solemn silence.\n\n\t\tThe black iron gates reluctantly open with a metallic yawn. When the two prisoners arrive at the gates’ threshold, their bonds are untied and they are thrust out onto the burning sands at spearpoint. The gates begin to close begrudgingly, groans of iron on iron voicing its complaints...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!100.X000!DE.dialogue_text:
A sudden rush of radiance flooding Eidos' eyes suggests that the burlap sack covering her head has been indelicately removed.

		Tears drown out all images as her eyes adjust to the biting brightness of the desert sun. Blurry forms sharpen and before long Eidos can see once more.

		Before her stands a stately old mage who seems to be more preoccupied with affairs of an urgency beyond any trouble Eidos could possibly bring him. After a several minutes, the old mage, muscular and spry despite the innumerable summers he has seen pass, turns to look at the unclean natural pariah his people have brought before him.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!100.001!DES.dialogue_text: And thus the sentence is handed down: Eidos is taken through imposing black iron gates to be exiled. Her bonds are removed and she is thrust out onto the burning sands at spearpoint. The gate begins to close begrudgingly, groans of iron on iron voicing its complaints...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.000!DYSMA.dialogue_text: "Well if it isn't my malefactor herself! Care to trade places?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.X001!DYSM.dialogue_text: "No? Very well then, have a pleasant day and may you wander into the embrace of the Ruby Jinn!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.001!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "You are a Wayfarer, right? In the vein of Torma, no doubt!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.002!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "It must be so, given your unique vestments - so uncharacteristic of the Kabu region, you see."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.003!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Say, what's someone like you doing visiting a condemned man, anyways?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.004!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Did you come to witness the Tacribian exile ritual? Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.005!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Or perhaps you wish to see for yourself what becomes of entering the Archives without the guiding presence of Logira!"

B.response_text: "Do you know why the aqueduct no longer carries water?"

C.response_text: "I'm merely observing this place and those within."

D.response_text: "Perhaps you'd like to be free of your imprisonment?"

E.response_text: "Such is what becomes of spies."

F.response_text: "I hope to participate. Will there be a ritual paddling to send you off?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.100!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Hmmm... Why else would someone clandestinely enter an Archives?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.1000!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Why for knowledge, of course! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.1001!HEYA.dialogue_text: "The Daziran preoccupation with unearthing relics and lore from antiquity makes Dazir largely blind to the records of more recent events."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.1002!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Specifically, I sought records concerning the events that date to the creation of the Dawn Fortress itself... And, I was successful!"

A.response_text: "Why was this worth violating the law?"

E.response_text: "Your discoveries seem to have done you little good."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.2000!HEYA.dialogue_text: "I care not for the Famlazian schemes of Khaa!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.2001!HEYA.dialogue_text: "In truth, they're one of the many tiresome things that caused me to abandon my hometown! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.2002!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Though a greater impulse to leave came from the desire to seek records concerning the events that date to the creation of the Dawn Fortress itself... though it landed me in this cage! Ha ha!"

A.response_text: "Why was this worth violating the law?"

C.response_text: "So you seek new lands to know?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.300!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Ah ha! A woman after half my own heart; for I too am a relentless observer! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.3000!HEYA.dialogue_text: "I am, however, perhaps more directed than you, dare I say."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.3001!HEYA.dialogue_text: "I knew what I came for when I entered the Archives and I achieved my goal!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.3002!HEYA.dialogue_text: "And very soon I am to be afforded a unique opportunity to enhance my learning in exile. Splendid!"

C.response_text: "So you seek new lands to know?"

D.response_text: "I understand that there is nothing for you in the Wasteland but death..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.400!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Hmmm... No! Indeed I violated Tacribian law, and by Biracul's beard, Khlutt is within his right to punish me!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.4000!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Besides, the most I could do would be to flee back to Tambul and hope they would open the Gate of Celestial Judgment for me!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.4001!HEYA.dialogue_text: "But what then? A life conversing with self-satisfied root cultivators? Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.4002!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Perhaps I could while away my evenings hearing Pakahron prattle on about the mundane concerns his dull township - it might help me get to sleep at least. Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.4003!HEYA.dialogue_text: "I'm sure you would agree that brain-eating draugnir would make finer conversation companions than most Kabans, is it not so? Ha ha!"

C.response_text: "So you seek new lands to know?"

D.response_text: "But what is there for you in the Wasteland?"

E.response_text: "Your discoveries seem to have done you little good."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.500!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Oh, you think this was an act of patriotism? Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.5000!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Then you clearly do not know our mage, Khaa!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.5001!HEYA.dialogue_text: "He has no interest in the learning of the Tacribians; to him their skulls are as empty as Old Tacriba itself!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.5002!HEYA.dialogue_text: "But I must say that he underestimates them, but then again, I suppose that is what becomes of he who lusts only after the knowledge already in his possession! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.5003!HEYA.dialogue_text: "So as you can see, I have no interest in returning to my hometown and it has no interest in my return!"

A.response_text: "Why was this worth violating the law?"

D.response_text: "I understand that there is nothing for you in the Wasteland but death..."

E.response_text: "Your discoveries seem to have done you little good."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.600!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Hmm... I've not seen the ritual in person, so I cannot say, though I believe that it will more likely involve invocations of Biracul, to guide me to a quick death, and of Ark, to prevent my return."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.6000!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Likely, there'll be mindless mouthing in the Old Tongue! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.6001!HEYA.dialogue_text: "I'll probably get more out of it than the Tacribians will!"

A.response_text: "Why was this worth violating the law?"

D.response_text: "I understand that there is nothing for you in the Wasteland but death."

F.response_text: "I hope to get me some of that sweet, sweet paddling... Yes..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.1011!HEYA.dialogue_text: "I learned much about the creation of this place; not only of the stone and mortar but of the cult of the Valvorthr! - perhaps I'm to become a modern loremaster? Ha ha! -"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.1012!HEYA.dialogue_text: "And now I go to the Wasteland to gain more Awareness!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.1015!HEYA.dialogue_text: "At any rate, what is certain is that I'll see the secrets of a land where most fear to tread! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.X1016!HEY.dialogue_text: "Splendid! To me, this is more a reward than a punishment, dare I say!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.201!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Well, I learned that a handful of the first guardians of the League did not hail from Tacriba, and that in fact Ark's most faithful and intimate companions against Rikharr were of Dazir - not surprising, given her Daziran heritage!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.2010!HEYA.dialogue_text: "This elite retinue established the cult of the Valvorthr to execute the final will of Ark! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.2011!HEYA.dialogue_text: "But I don't glory in the achievements of my ancestors."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.2013!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Instead my pride is in knowing that I've chipped away at the mask concealing the bashful face of truth!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.X2014!HEY.dialogue_text: "Ironic that they give me time to seek Awareness, when they themselves lack it! Ho ho!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.3010!HEYA.dialogue_text: "I never played as Torma the Wayfarer as a child."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.3011!HEYA.dialogue_text: "No, no, no, instead I seek to understand myself and my people! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.3012!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Every step of this journey leads me further and further away from my homeland, nut I know not where it all will lead in the end!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.X3013!HEY.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Though I don't share in his goals, perhaps I'll share in Torma's fate and become lost to all human knowledge! Ha ha! Splendid!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.401!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Oh not just death! But knowledge! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.4010!HEYA.dialogue_text: "And knowledge is everything, dare I say!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.4011!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Perhaps I'll be killed in the Wasteland, though perhaps not!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.4012!HEYA.dialogue_text: "What is for certain, though, is that I'll see the secrets of a land where most fear to tread!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.4013!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Thus, I accept my punishment, or dare I say 'reward', gladly!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.X4014!HEY.dialogue_text: "In the Shining One's words: 'Though one be confronted with the hordes of the Graylands, through me you will see through the unblinking inner eye and know the truth within the illusion.' Splendid!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.501!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Hmm... I'm sure you would think so! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.5010!HEYA.dialogue_text: "But then, again, that's because you aren't seeking knowledge, now are you?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.5011!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Though you stand in judgment over the apparent futility of my actions, I assure you that I have few regrets in life!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.X5012!HEY.dialogue_text: "And by Biracul's beard, I'd say it's no wonder you and I are in different situations when we have such divergent goals! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.601!HEYAR.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Then by Biracul's beard, perhaps you should find yourself a tolerant... partner, to more reliably... quench your thirst for such delights..?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.X6011!HEY.dialogue_text: "Though I doubt you'll find any among us prudish ragamuffins from Kabu!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.X899!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Yes! My one regret is that I haven't the means to record my findings!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.X8990!HEY.dialogue_text: "Thus, I'll spend my time here committing them to my Palace of Memory. Splendid!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.X001!HEY.dialogue_text: "Hmm... So, you're coming around after all! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.0000!HEY.dialogue_text: "I request that you take care, stranger; for I'd guess it'd be in our mutual interest to have a companion in exile to the Wasteland!"

D.response_text: "Why do you speak of exile?!"

E.response_text: "You presume much... You have no idea who I am."

F.response_text: "Oh goody! I've always wanted a pet!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.001!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Hmm... So, you're coming around after all! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.0010!HEY.dialogue_text: "I request that you take care, stranger; for I'd guess it'd be in our mutual interest to have a companion in exile to the Wasteland!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.0011!HEY.dialogue_text: "Why just a spell ago, a Tambulan named Dysmas was exiled for high treason and sabotage against Kabu... and by none other than the orders of Pakahron himself! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.0012!HEY.dialogue_text: "In fact, he was given the highest form of punishment: the brand of the Unseen..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.0013!HEY.dialogue_text: "After the less-than-painless alteration, he walked through the Gates of Dawn and out into the Wasteland fearlessly!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.0014!HEY.dialogue_text: "I sure do hope we can emulate his bravery! Ha ha!"

D.response_text: "Why do you speak of exile?"

E.response_text: "You presume much... You have no idea who I am."

F.response_text: "Why would they exile me? Everyone loves me!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.100!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Who me? Ho ho! My name is Heyar! I'm a scholar hailing from the township of Dazir!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.1000!HEY.dialogue_text: "As to why I'm here, well my crime was trespassing in the fortress Archives without permission... and for my troubles, I am to be exiled to the Wasteland! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.1001!HEY.dialogue_text: "I'd assume a woman heralded as the bringer of Tacribian genocide would deserve a punitive response of at least equal measure, dare I say!"

E.response_text: "If they do not release me, I'll exile their heads from their bodies."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.2000!HEY.dialogue_text: "Well, you're in the Dawn Fortress, of course!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.2001!HEY.dialogue_text: "Could it be that you're unfamiliar with the people that you've condemned to walk the Graylands with your liquid pox?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.2002!HEY.dialogue_text: "Or perhaps you also don't know the doom for which you've been attributed!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.2003!HEY.dialogue_text: "As to why I'm here, well my crime was trespassing in the fortress Archives without permission... And for my troubles I'm to be exiled to the Wasteland! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.2004!HEY.dialogue_text: "I'd assume a woman heralded as the bringer of Tacribian genocide would deserve a punitive response of at least equal measure, dare I say!"

C.response_text: "What will become of us in the Wasteland?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.300!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Your best? Well, then I shall take heart! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.3000!HEY.dialogue_text: "Though my humble crime was merely trespassing in the fortress Archives without permission, if your past efforts have brought about the downfall of an entire culture, perhaps you have yet more miracles to perform! Splendid!"

C.response_text: "What will become of us in the Wasteland?"

D.response_text: "I did nothing of the sort!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.400!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Yes! That's to be our fated punishment!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.4000!HEY.dialogue_text: "Well... my fated punishment, at any rate - though I imagine you'll share in this destiny! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.4001!HEY.dialogue_text: "You see, revenge is a vice in which the Tacribians often indulge..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.4002!HEY.dialogue_text: "For example, for trespassing in the fortress Archives without permission, I am to be exiled to the Wasteland! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.4003!HEY.dialogue_text: "I'd assume a woman heralded as the bringer of Tacribian genocide would deserve a punitive response of at least equal measure, dare I say!"

C.response_text: "What will become of us in the Wasteland?"

D.response_text: "I did nothing of the sort!"

E.response_text: "If they do not release me, I'll exile their heads from their bodies."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.500!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Well, I know the crime for which you've been accused! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.5000!HEY.dialogue_text: "It seems you've been labeled the harbinger of slaughter!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.5001!HEY.dialogue_text: "Apparently, you arrived on a tide of poisoned water and they assume there was some causal link..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.5002!HEY.dialogue_text: "However, justice is a crude instrument when wielded by the Tacribian League!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.5003!HEY.dialogue_text: "For example, my crime was trespassing in the fortress Archives without permission, and for doing so I shall be exiled to the Wasteland! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.5004!HEY.dialogue_text: "I'd assume a woman heralded as the bringer of Tacribian genocide would deserve a punitive response of at least equal measure, dare I say!"

D.response_text: "I did nothing of the sort!"

E.response_text: "If they do not release me, I have yet more slaughter to bring."

F.response_text: "No, 'yes' was the correct answer."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.6000!HEY.dialogue_text: "By Biracul's beard, did I hear you correctly, did you say pet?"

F.response_text: "Like I said, 'yes' is the correct answer."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.6001!HEY.dialogue_text: "You're as jinnstruck as that itinerant Prophet, I dare say!"

F.response_text: "Though this is the first I've seen a talking rooster..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.6005!HEY.dialogue_text: "Love you?! Ha ha! It seems you've been labeled the harbinger of slaughter!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.60050!HE.dialogue_text: "Apparently, you arrived on a tide of poisoned water and they assumed there was some causal link..."

F.response_text: "I bring them water and they exile me? What ingrates!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.60051!HE.dialogue_text: "I suppose they took exception to the fact you spiked it with poison... Ha ha!"

F.response_text: "Picky, picky, picky! Oh well, more for us!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.60052!HE.dialogue_text: "Well, you seem fun enough! Ha ha! Just remind me never to ask you for water! Ho ho!"

F.response_text: "A good idea! Because poison wasn't the only other addition to the water!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.101!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Well, why else would someone clandestinely enter an Archives?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.1010!HEY.dialogue_text: "Why for knowledge, of course! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.1011!HEY.dialogue_text: "You see, the Daziran preoccupation with unearthing relics and lore from antiquity makes Dazir largely blind to the record of more recent events."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.1012!HEY.dialogue_text: "In truth, this fixation on the ancient is one of the many tiresome things that caused me to abandon my hometown! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.201!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Oh! Well, by Biracul's beard! Perhaps you truly are blameless after all! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.2010!HEY.dialogue_text: "For the past few weeks, the folk of the Dawn Fortress have been on the brink of thirst, because the Wellspring aqueduct supplying this place grew dry, and its flow unflowy!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.2011!HEY.dialogue_text: "Naturally many suspected Khaa was behind this treachery..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.20110!HE.dialogue_text: "But with the Gate of Celestial judgment preventing the Tacribians from mob justice, they were forced to slake their thirst with the meager rations the Tambulans could afford to hand out - instead of with Daziran blood!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.2012!HEY.dialogue_text: "All hope was lost! Their doom was at hand!!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.2013!HEY.dialogue_text: "But then, as their Trueflesh began tugging at the frayed tatters of the False, as they prepared for the final march into the Grays! Out of nowhere came a torrent of fresh water, bearing their supposed salvation along with a strange, half-drowned outlander..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.2014!HEY.dialogue_text: "That would be you, in case you were wondering! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.2016!HEY.dialogue_text: "You see, the water bore a deadly corruption, which was only discovered after they'd all become quite intoxicated by the author of their death!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.2017!HEY.dialogue_text: "Their contempt for my life and well being became an ironic blessing..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.2018!HEY.dialogue_text: "For you see, they had already given me my daily skin of water, and intended to give me no more until the morrow! Ha ha! Splendid!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.301!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Hmm... It depends on what one seeks!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.3015!HEY.dialogue_text: "Ah ha! Well then there's plenty of treasure yet unplundered in those sundering plains!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.3016!HEY.dialogue_text: "Perhaps we'll be killed in the Wasteland!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.3018!HEY.dialogue_text: "But what is certain is that we'll see the secrets of a land where most fear to tread!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.3019!HEY.dialogue_text: "So, I accept my punishment gladly! Splendid!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.30190!HE.dialogue_text: "In the words of the Shining One himself: 'Though one be confronted with the hordes of the Graylands, through me you will see through the unblinking inner eye and know the truth within the illusion.' "

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.30191!HE.dialogue_text: "Take heart outlander! For the only peril we face is that of becoming the persons we always should have been! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.401!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Then you need not fear! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.4010!HEY.dialogue_text: "Indeed, the technocognition of both Khlutt and Logira is held in high esteem by even my Tacribian-hating people!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.4011!HEY.dialogue_text: "They will know the truth of all matters when they peer into your thoughts."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.4012!HEY.dialogue_text: "The Tacribians are harsh, but they're true Kabans and followers of Biracul!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.4013!HEY.dialogue_text: "Yes, if you're innocent of these accusations, no harm will come to you, outlander!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.501!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Hmm... I would implore you against such useless gestures of violence! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.5010!HEY.dialogue_text: "That you still breathe is only by their good graces and their devotion to the Path of Awareness."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.5012!HEY.dialogue_text: "The technocognition of both Khlutt and Logira is renowned; they will know the truth of all matters when they peer into your thoughts!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.5013!HEY.dialogue_text: "The Tacribians may be harsh, but they're true Kabans and followers of Biracul..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.5014!HEY.dialogue_text: "If you're innocent of these accusations, no harm will come to you!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.601!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Hmm... I can't say I've ever heard of any so far gone in all of history!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.6010!HEY.dialogue_text: "But you seem fun enough! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.6011!HEY.dialogue_text: "Let's learn all we can in the Wasteland together!"

F.response_text: "Yes! I shall name you 'Winged Angel of Roostor and Stalphoslover IV'!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.X000!HEY.dialogue_text: "Hmm... So, you're coming around after all! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.001!HEYA.dialogue_text: "I request that you take care, Eidos; I'd guess it'd be in our mutual interest to have a companion in exile to the Wasteland!"

A.response_text: "You would wish to travel the Waste with me?"

D.response_text: "Why do you speak of my exile?"

E.response_text: "I am not your companion, nor shall I ever be."

F.response_text: "Oh goody! I've always wanted a pet!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.0010!HEY.dialogue_text: "Hmm... So, you're coming around after all! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.0011!HEY.dialogue_text: "I request that you take care, Eidos; I'd guess it'd be in our mutual interest to have a companion in exile to the Wasteland."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.0012!HEY.dialogue_text: "Why just a day ago a Tambulan named Dysmas was exiled for high treason and sabotage against Kabu by orders of Pakahron himself! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.0013!HEY.dialogue_text: "He was given the highest form of punishment: the curse of the Unseen..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.0014!HEY.dialogue_text: "After the less-than-painless alteration, he walked through the Gates of Dawn alone, into the Wasteland, fearlessly!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.0015!HEY.dialogue_text: "I wonder what has become of him... Hmm..."

A.response_text: "You would wish to travel the Waste with me?"

D.response_text: "Why do you speak of my exile?"

E.response_text: "I am not your companion, nor shall I ever be."

F.response_text: "Oh goody! I've always wanted a pet!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.100!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Yes, of course! Why ever not? Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.1000!HEY.dialogue_text: "By Biracul's beard, just because I seek to know the Wasteland doesn't mean I seek solitude!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.1001!HEY.dialogue_text: "True isolation would be a punishment worse than death!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.1002!HEY.dialogue_text: "For knowledge and discoveries are meant to be shared and discussed, is it not so? Ha ha!"

A.response_text: "Exile? But I didn't mean to hurt anyone!"

E.response_text: "I will slaughter the lot of them!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.2000!HEY.dialogue_text: "Just as the Tacribians' Trueflesh began tugging at the frayed tatters of the False, here came a torrent of fresh water, bearing their supposed salvation along with a strange, half-drowned outlander..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.2003!HEY.dialogue_text: "As the water bore a deadly corruption, which was only discovered after they'd all become quite intoxicated by the author of their death!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.2004!HEY.dialogue_text: "Their contempt for my life and well being became an ironic blessing..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.2005!HEY.dialogue_text: "For you see, they'd already given me my daily skin of water and intended to give me no more until the morrow! Ha ha! Splendid!"

A.response_text: "But, I didn't mean to kill anybody!"

C.response_text: "What will become of us in the Wasteland?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.300!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Hmm... Well, then I shall take heart! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.3000!HEY.dialogue_text: "My crime was merely trespassing in the fortress Archives without permission, but if your past efforts have brought about the downfall of an entire culture, perhaps you have yet more miracles to perform! Splendid!"

B.response_text: "I do not understand how this happened."

C.response_text: "What will become of us in the Wasteland?"

D.response_text: "I did nothing of the sort!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.101!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Ho ho! Well, regardless of what you intended, my friend, I'd guess the results are sufficient to overcome what little sympathy our captors are capable of! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.1010!HEY.dialogue_text: "But fear not outlander, for while you may have sentenced the Tacribians to death, they'll likely not respond in kind."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.1011!HEY.dialogue_text: "...or at least not directly in kind..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.1012!HEY.dialogue_text: "You see, exile is, to them, more severe a punishment than death!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.1013!HEY.dialogue_text: "But I assure you, our punishment will be just another adventure, at the edge of human experience and discovery! Splendid!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.201!HEYA.dialogue_text: "Hmm... The technocognition of both Khlutt and Logira is held in high esteem by even my Tacribian-hating people."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.2010!HEY.dialogue_text: "I dare say, you'll soon understand! Ha ha!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.X000!ISSA.dialogue_text: "Be careful if you speak to that Daziran serpent!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.001!ISSAM.dialogue_text: "He will no doubt wish to make an ally of you in an effort to save his own skin."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.002!ISSAM.dialogue_text: "And should you wish to ally yourself to his cause, there is plenty of room in that cage for another Kharrspawn, if you catch my drift."

D.response_text: "I would never ally myself with a Daziran!"

E.response_text: "Why haven't you killed him already?"

F.response_text: "So you fancy yourself a herpetologist, eh?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.003!ISSAM.dialogue_text: "Be careful when speaking to that Daziran serpent!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.004!ISSAM.dialogue_text: "He no doubt wishes to make an ally of you in an effort to save his own skin."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.005!ISSAM.dialogue_text: "And if you have allied yourself to his cause, there is plenty of room in that cage for another Kharrspawn, if you catch my drift."

A.response_text: "We are not allies, though I feel sympathy for him."

D.response_text: "I would never ally myself with a Daziran!"

E.response_text: "Why haven't you killed him already?"

F.response_text: "So you fancy yourself a herpetologist, eh?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.100!ISSAM.dialogue_text: "He is an artisan of some sort, likely as not - all those arrogant Dazirans are - and is probably some sort of expert in Vanquished relics."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.1000!ISSA.dialogue_text: "Though you can clearly see how his Kharrspawn 'mastery' has availed him as he rots away in his cell."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.1001!ISSA.dialogue_text: "If Khlutt finds some means of crossing the canyon, we will make short work of these limp-wristed scholar types!"

A.response_text: "What will become of him once he is exiled?"

E.response_text: "I believe 'if' is the key word in that statement."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.10000!ISS.dialogue_text: "If you wish to keep him company in exile, keep talking about your 'sympathy' for Kharrspawn..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.10001!ISS.dialogue_text: "You would do well to remember that you are only allowed to be here because Khlutt doesn't see a weakling like you as a threat."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.10002!ISS.dialogue_text: "But you make one wrong move, and I'll personally send you to dance with the Jinns in the Graylands!"

A.response_text: "What will become of him once he is exiled?"

E.response_text: "I doubt you'd be so brave without all your peers around."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.200!ISSAM.dialogue_text: "He was trespassing in the Archives. We hold him on charges of espionage and attempted sabotage."

A.response_text: "What will become of him once he is exiled?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.300!ISSAM.dialogue_text: "You would be wise to respect us, stranger; for we are the true strength of Kabu."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.3000!ISSA.dialogue_text: "Would that this man's leader had had enough sense to do the same..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.3001!ISSA.dialogue_text: "But instead, Khaa doomed his people once he crossed us!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.3002!ISSA.dialogue_text: "When Khlutt finds a means to cross the canyon, they will all dance with the Jinns in the Graylands, the lot of them!"

D.response_text: "Is Khlutt close to devising a plan?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.400!ISSAM.dialogue_text: "You're at least smart enough to respect us, stranger; for we are the true strength of Kabu."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.4000!ISSA.dialogue_text: "Would that this man's leader had had sense enough to do the same..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.4001!ISSA.dialogue_text: "But instead, he doomed his people once he crossed us."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.4002!ISSA.dialogue_text: "When Khlutt finds a means to cross the canyon, their Valley of Bones will be filled to bursting!"

D.response_text: "Is Khlutt close to devising a plan?"

E.response_text: "I believe you mean 'If Khlutt finds...'."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.500!ISSAM.dialogue_text: "It is the custom of those sentenced to exile that they be permitted to abide in the Dawn Fortress for one month - barring extreme cases."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.5000!ISSA.dialogue_text: "This way they may come to terms with their crimes and have one final chance for Awareness before the end."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.5001!ISSA.dialogue_text: "I suppose you could say all of Dazir is undergoing such contemplation, caged up in that town of theirs."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.5002!ISSA.dialogue_text: "But their period of atonement ends when Khlutt finds a means to cross the canyon!"

A.response_text: "What will become of him once he is exiled?"

D.response_text: "Is Khlutt close to devising a plan?"

E.response_text: "He won't; you idiots are completely at their mercy."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.600!ISSAM.dialogue_text: "What? No, you fool, I was speaking poetically!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.6000!ISSA.dialogue_text: "He is a conniving Daziran sentenced to exile."

A.response_text: "What will become of him once he is exiled?"

F.response_text: "Can't take any chances, might be a snake in disguise... Let's do a strip search."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.101!ISSAM.dialogue_text: "He'll wander the Wasteland until he meets his death."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.1010!ISSA.dialogue_text: "We'll provide him with a final ration food and water at Ark's Beacon, but if he is wise, he'll cast them aside."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.1011!ISSA.dialogue_text: "After all, better to die of thirst than to be rent apart by the draugnir, or eaten alive by the cursed Unseen."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.X1012!ISS.dialogue_text: "Mark this well, outlander: this is the punishment that awaits those who violate our laws..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.2010!ISSA.dialogue_text: "He is our criminal to pass judgment upon, outlander."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.301!ISSAM.dialogue_text: "If you have no interest in this, why are you talking to me about the condemned?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.401!ISSAM.dialogue_text: "It is only a matter of time!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.4010!ISSA.dialogue_text: "We have protected Kabu from horrors darker than death or night for hundreds of years, so I think we can handle a simple canyon."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.501!ISSAM.dialogue_text: "You have no faith, but it doesn't matter."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.5010!ISSA.dialogue_text: "You're not the first to underestimate us."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.5011!ISSA.dialogue_text: "Just pray that you are not an enemy of Tacriba when we march to battle!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.X5012!ISS.dialogue_text: "And mark this prisoner well, outlander, for this is the punishment that awaits those who violate our laws..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.X5013!ISS.dialogue_text: "Leave now, unless you want to feed the buzzards."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.601!ISSAM.dialogue_text: "Listen, you idiot, he isn't literally a snake! He's..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.6010!ISSA.dialogue_text: "Why am I even talking to you?!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!0.X900!ISSA.dialogue_text: "Move along, outlander; nothing to see here."

F.response_text: "Hello..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!77.000!KHLU.dialogue_text: "Oh, so I hear you are Ark returned to the Falseflesh..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!77.001!KHLU.dialogue_text: "I warn you, outlander, you may be able to fool this Valvorthr, but you'll find me a more reluctant convert."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!77.002!KHLU.dialogue_text: "But there is one way to find out..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!77.003!KHLU.dialogue_text: "If you're truly Ark, then you should have no problem defeating me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!77.X004!KHL.dialogue_text: "And if you're not... Well, then the fallen Archmage remains in the Graylands and you'll soon join her."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!78.001!KHLU.dialogue_text: "I don't know what foul Daziran tricks you used to steal the ghelblade, but now it returns to worthy hands."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!78.002!KHLU.dialogue_text: "Tacribians, drag this Kharrspawn and the Daziran spy to the Gates of Dawn - though even the Pit is too generous a punishment for their ilk!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!78.003!KHLU.dialogue_text: "Recall all the Rangers from the Wastes!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!78.004!KHLU.dialogue_text: "We've got to pay a visit to the enemies of Ark!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!78.005!KHLU.dialogue_text: "If they will not give us water to drink, then their blood will slake our thirst!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!90.X000!KHL.dialogue_text: "The accused will speak her name; for what is known to Biracul, shall be known to his servants and preserved for those that would come later."

D.response_text: "... I have forgotten my name."

E.response_text: "I have no intention of answering your inane questions."

F.response_text: "Stalphos Gremlinsbane! And don't you forget it!"

D.response_text: "What is this violence that you have done to my mind!?"

E.response_text: "Take your hand from me or you'll soon draw back a stump."

F.response_text: "I was immaculately conceived by Roostor, you ignoramus!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!92.000!KHLU.dialogue_text: "You have been borne to the Dawn Fortress on a torrent of corrupted water, and already, the jinnvenom works its ruin in our Falseflesh."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!92.001!KHLU.dialogue_text: "It will not be long before we all walk the Graylands with Ark."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!92.X002!KHL.dialogue_text: "Now speak! Was this doom of your making?"

B.response_text: "It might be so; I am not sure what I did."

D.response_text: "No, of course not!"

E.response_text: "This is only the beginning if you do not release me!"

F.response_text: "How am I supposed to remember such trivial details?!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!93.X000!KHL.dialogue_text: "For what purpose? What design is in our deaths?"

B.response_text: "I wanted to see what would happen."

D.response_text: "I tell you, this witch is speaking lies! I did not do this!"

E.response_text: "I wanted you all to die."

F.response_text: "My policy is maximum randomness! How could I refuse?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!93.X100!KHL.dialogue_text: "What caused you to infiltrate the holy Wellspring in the first place?"

A.response_text: "I was on a mission from Logira."

D.response_text: "I intended to save you, but I was betrayed by this witch!"

E.response_text: "That is none of your concern."

F.response_text: "My policy is maximum randomness! How could I refuse?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!93.X200!KHL.dialogue_text: "What caused you to infiltrate the holy Wellspring in the first place?"

A.response_text: "I sought to learn more of your people."

D.response_text: "I intended to save you, of course!"

E.response_text: "That is none of your concern."

F.response_text: "My policy is maximum randomness! How could I refuse?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!93.X300!KHL.dialogue_text: "For what purpose? What design is in our deaths?"

A.response_text: "I knew of your plight, and attempted to restore the water."

D.response_text: "I'm not to blame! A lunatic in the Wellspring caused this!"

E.response_text: "I wanted you all to die."

F.response_text: "My policy is maximum randomness! How could I refuse?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!93.X400!KHL.dialogue_text: "For what purpose? What design is in our deaths?"

A.response_text: "I was made to believe it was the only way to preserve life in Kabu."

B.response_text: "I was on a mission from Khaa."

D.response_text: "Khaa commanded me to do this! The fault is his!"

E.response_text: "I wanted you all to die."

F.response_text: "My policy is maximum randomness! How could I refuse?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!94.001!KHLU.dialogue_text: "What is your aim in realms seen and unseen?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!94.X002!KHL.dialogue_text: "Speak the truth! All is revealed under the eye of Biracul."

D.response_text: "...I mean you and your people no harm, Khlutt!"

E.response_text: "Right now, I would settle for bathing in your blood."

F.response_text: "I think you mean Biracul's ear... since we're speaking, right?

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!95.001!KHLU.dialogue_text: "While I know many of you would seek to have this foul creature suffer the most horrific punishments a Jinn could devise, I decree we let her stand as a living testament!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!95.002!KHLU.dialogue_text: "We are the last true children of Biracul!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!95.003!KHLU.dialogue_text: "Let us send this message into the void as our forebearers did in the days of Ark!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!96.001!KHLU.dialogue_text: "While I know many of you would seek to have this foul creature suffer the most horrific punishments a Jinn could devise, I decree we let her stand as a living testament!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!96.002!KHLU.dialogue_text: "We are the last true children of Biracul!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!96.003!KHLU.dialogue_text: "Let us send this message into the void as our forebearers in the days of Ark!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!96.X004!KHL.dialogue_text: "Logira, read to us the defense of this woman."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!96.100!KHLU.dialogue_text: "Then she is stained!? A filthy Unseen!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!96.101!KHLU.dialogue_text: "But that's impossible... Did Khaa work this evil?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!96.103!KHLU.dialogue_text: "The spawn of a Jinn, that's what you must be!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!96.104!KHLU.dialogue_text: "Else some shadow of Rikharr, born of the Black Pit to work our ruin!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!96.105!KHLU.dialogue_text: "While your nature may go unknown to us, all is known to the Eye of Biracul!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!96.106!KHLU.dialogue_text: "An abomination of the Wasteland I name you!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!96.107!KHLU.dialogue_text: "The desolation of your will and word shall be ground to nothing by the wind and sand!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!96.108!KHLU.dialogue_text: "From the corrupted Wastes you come, and to them you return!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!100.000!KHL.dialogue_text: "Even in our darkest hour, on the very brink of thirst, those fools still see it fit to send me their criminals..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!100.001!KHL.dialogue_text: "Nevertheless, I will once more prove that we Tacribians are the only true children of Biracul!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!100.002!KHL.dialogue_text: "By law you are to be exiled to the Wastes, though it gives me no pleasure to aid our malefactors."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!100.003!KHL.dialogue_text: "Take her to the Gates of Dawn, immediately!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!91.X000!LOG.dialogue_text: "...'I awoke far from here, underground, the Sanctuary... I remember nothing before this awakening.'..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!92.X000!LOG.dialogue_text: "...'Yes, through the destruction of a crystal.'..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!92.000!LOGI.dialogue_text: "...'Yes, through the destruction of a crystal.'..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!92.X001!LOG.dialogue_text: "...'Though I did not know it would result in your deaths.'..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!92.X011!LOG.dialogue_text: "...'I did this even though I knew it would lead to your demise.'..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!92.X200!LOG.dialogue_text: "...'Yes, I compelled the Wellspring to release the water.'..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!92.200!LOGI.dialogue_text: "...'Yes, I compelled the Wellspring to release the water.'..."

D.response_text: SUR

E.response_text: TYR

F.response_text: LOO

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!93.X200!LOG.dialogue_text: "...'My purpose has always been the pursuit of truth.'..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!93.X300!LOG.dialogue_text: "...'I have no prime directive; I let what happens happen.'..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!93.X400!LOG.dialogue_text: "...'I simply wish to survive another day.'..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!93.X600!LOG.dialogue_text: "...'To celebrate the... Mighty Comb of Lord Roostor.'..?"

D.response_text: SUR

E.response_text: TYR

F.response_text: LOO

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!94.100!LOGI.dialogue_text: "...'I would see order, resolution. I would see myself as an unmoved mover of the world we live in.'..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!94.200!LOGI.dialogue_text: "...'I wish to know - the only noble kind of work. Lives are but shadows to the light that is truth.'..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!94.300!LOGI.dialogue_text: "...'I am a wanderer, going where chance takes me, compelled by forces I neither understand nor wish to. I am nothing.'..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!94.400!LOGI.dialogue_text: "...'My survival is all that matters. Everything else is trivial in comparison.'..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!94.500!LOGI.dialogue_text: "...'I will make this world a reflection of the only thing that matters: me.'..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!COURTYARD!95.001!LOGI.dialogue_text: "But how odd, it's clearly not by our design..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!0.000!D.dialogue_text: Eidos approaches the the massive, black iron gates of the Dawn Fortress. A retinue of guards flanks the gate, all eyes facing the outside. They watch, observe, and fear the Wasteland beyond, looking through the thin gaps between the thick iron bars. All here are clearly more concerned by what might enter than by what could exit.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!0.X001!.dialogue_text: As she approaches the gate to leave, one of the guards steps forward to meet her.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!0.X002!.dialogue_text: The foreboding door to the Wasteland now seems to pulsate, leaving Eidos mesmerized before it. The Wastes behind it belch wisps of sand, forced in through thin gaps in the bars. These ominous exhalations of anticipation seem a warning to her, a prelude to the untamed corruption waiting beyond the walls of the Dawn Fortress.\n\n\t\tA shiver runs down her spine, breaking the spell. She soon turns on her heel and walks back to the courtyard.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!0.002!D.dialogue_text: The foreboding door to the Wasteland now seems to pulsate, leaving Eidos mesmerized before it. The Wastes behind it belch wisps of sand, forced in through thin gaps in the bars. These ominous exhalations of anticipation seem a warning to her, a prelude to the untamed corruption waiting beyond the walls of the Dawn Fortress.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!0.0020!.dialogue_text: Malik then looks to a window in the upper walls of the fortress, whistling his command. The gate begins to open begrudgingly, groans of iron on sand voicing its complaints. A flood of wind and sand blast in through the aperture, daring Eidos to cross the threshold. But her resolve is unwavering, even now.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!0.0021!.dialogue_text: She remembers only her first step, taking her counter-current to the wind; each laborious step that followed, however, is simply hinted at in retrospect, as she hears that familiar groan from the gates sealing away the covetous howls of the Wasteland winds.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!0.0022!.dialogue_text: There is no turning back now.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!92.000!.dialogue_text: Eidos and her captors are joined at the gates by another prisoner - a daft-looking cheerful type who seems to be laughing at a joke he's telling himself, in the privacy of his own head, thankfully.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!92.001!.dialogue_text: Eidos now stares at the foreboding door to the Wasteland, frozen before it. The Wastes beyond belch wisps of sand, forced in through thin gaps in the gate's metallic grin.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!92.002!.dialogue_text: A gatekeeper then looks to a window in the upper walls of the fortress, whistling his command. The gate begins to open begrudgingly, groans of iron on sand voicing its complaints. A flood of wind and sand blast in through the aperture, lashing out at the petty creatures who so brazenly seek to keep them out.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!92.003!.dialogue_text: The two prisoners' bonds are removed and they are thrust out onto the burning sands at spearpoint. She remembers only her first step, taking her counter-current to the wind; each laborious step thereafter, however, is only hinted at in retrospect, as she hears that familiar groan from the gates sealing away the covetous howls of the Wasteland winds.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!999.X00.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!999.001.dialogue_text: Other guards inspect the body of their fallen mage and shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. In clockwork unison, the warriors gather around Eidos. Wordlessly, they move, as though compelled by the unspoken directives of their slain commander, the flame of his instructions still burning brightly within them. Stone-faced, they begin their task, like a cadre of unthinking, unfeeling Neverborn automata.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!999.002.dialogue_text: One of the soldiers then crouches down at her side to begin ruthlessly packing a band of cloth down her throat. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!999.003.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!999.004.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!999.005.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!999.006.dialogue_text: The warriors somberly sing a mournful dirge for their fallen leader as they witness Eidos' departure from the Falseflesh, knowing she will now go to do battle with Khlutt in the Graylands...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!0.000!M.dialogue_text: "Unless you seek an early death, you should move along."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!0.001!M.dialogue_text: "Beyond these gates are lands unloved by Ark, and only a Tacribian can return from them untainted."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!0.X002!.dialogue_text: "You are free to leave, but make no mistake, you will never come back."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!1.X001!.dialogue_text: "We'll waste no more time on you."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!GATES OF DAWN!4.000!M.dialogue_text: "...just ignore her, Malik; just ignore her..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.000!DE.dialogue_text: Light pours in through long, narrow windows high on the western walls, like a dozen eyes peering down in divine judgment. Beneath these windows, another set of eyes scornfully appraises Eidos from the shadows - eyes she cannot see, but whose vivisecting gaze she can most palpably feel. She feels that these invisible eyes beckon her, though the curtain of brilliance the windows' light casts makes it impossible to determine who - or what - lurks in the wall's penumbra but fifty paces hence.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.001!DE.dialogue_text: She begins to carve a path through the dust motes floating in the afternoon sun, getting ever closer to that motionless creature. Twenty paces off, the form gains in clarity. More onyx statue than human being, it sits upon and elevated platform, immobile, absolute, and intractable. Its oppressive aura is enough to make the brave cowardly and the belligerent docile.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.002!DE.dialogue_text: Within ten paces, it authoritatively raises a hand commanding her to stop. The shadowy figure now finally comes into focus. Lines sharpen and colors separate. Sitting there before her is a lean, somewhat muscular man of advancing years, his face etched with a perpetual scowl.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.X003!D.dialogue_text: To say the man was unenthusiastic about her approach would be to call the sun lukewarm. Though, for the moment, he simply glares at Eidos. Calculating. Assessing. Planning. But after a lengthy silence and a domineering staredown, he deigns to speak...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.004!DE.dialogue_text: Having finished with the interrogation, Eidos can see she is somehow even less welcome here than before. Now all that is left is for her to depart.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!999.X000.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted herself well beyond her limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!999.001!.dialogue_text: Other guards inspect the body of their fallen mage and shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. In clockwork unison, the warriors gather around Eidos. Wordlessly, they move, as though compelled by the unspoken directives of their slain commander, the flame of his instructions still burning brightly within them. Stone-faced, they begin their task, like a cadre of unthinking, unfeeling Neverborn automata.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!999.002!.dialogue_text: One of the soldiers then crouches down at her side to begin ruthlessly packing a band of cloth down her throat. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!999.003!.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!999.004!.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!999.005!.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!999.006!.dialogue_text: The warriors somberly sing a mournful dirge for their fallen leader as they witness Eidos' departure from the Falseflesh, knowing she will now go to do battle with Khlutt in the Graylands...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.001!KH.dialogue_text: "So, another outlander trespassing into our domain."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.X0010!.dialogue_text: "Be silent. My Truesight will speak your true intentions for you."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.X0011!.dialogue_text: "Resist, and I will cripple your Falseflesh along with the True..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.005!KH.dialogue_text: "So, another outlander trespassing into our domain."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.0050!K.dialogue_text: "Be silent. My Truesight will speak your true intentions for you."

D.response_text: _Use Hidden Mind Techne_

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.006!KH.dialogue_text: "Resist, and I will cripple your Falseflesh along with the true..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.009!KH.dialogue_text: "...Eidos, I see nothing in your mind that is of any interest to me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.010!KH.dialogue_text: "Speak your piece, but be brief, as there is much that requires my attention that far exceeds any of your needs in import and urgency."

D.response_text: "I was wondering if you needed an ally in your conflicts..."

E.response_text: "My business is my own, but I'd be happy to teach you some manners."

F.response_text: "I am in search of quests for the purposes of leveling up."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.100!KH.dialogue_text: "To have such frivolous goals is the mark of many a Kharrspawned vagabond."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1000!K.dialogue_text: "Whether you rejected the responsibilities of your own tribe or were banished from it, I doubt you would find much that would interest you here..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1001!K.dialogue_text: "Here, the Dawn Fortress, where Discipline and Duty call home."

A.response_text: "I've heard of your dispute with Dazir."

B.response_text: "It is my very ignorance of your people that brings me here."

E.response_text: "You know nothing of me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2000!K.dialogue_text: "This is not a school for peace-drunk idiots; it's the last bastion of civilization against the void of the Wasteland."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2001!K.dialogue_text: "Your presence is neither needed nor desired."

A.response_text: "I've heard of your dispute with Dazir."

B.response_text: "I wish to understand this 'void' you speak of."

C.response_text: "Perhaps I shall continue on to the Wasteland."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.300!KH.dialogue_text: "We are not a rest stop for wandering vagrants, jinnslave."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3000!K.dialogue_text: "Besides, the only place to pass through is into the Wasteland."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3001!K.dialogue_text: "So it seems you have trapped yourself in the lion's den, little lamb."

B.response_text: "I wish to learn more of this place."

C.response_text: "I guess I'll go to the Wasteland."

D.response_text: "I could tell you what's happening on the other side of the canyon..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.X400!K.dialogue_text: "What service could you possibly render to us?!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4000!K.dialogue_text: "We have no use for sycophants and opportunists."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4001!K.dialogue_text: "It's our duty to expertly protect the works of Biracul, and you seem ill-suited to the task."

C.response_text: "I guess I'll go to the Wasteland."

D.response_text: "I could tell you what's happening on the other side of the canyon..."

E.response_text: "You know nothing of me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4002!K.dialogue_text: "What service could you possibly render to us?!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4003!K.dialogue_text: "We have no use for sycophants and opportunists."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4004!K.dialogue_text: "It's our duty to expertly protect the works of Biracul, and you seem ill-suited to the task."

C.response_text: "I guess I'll go to the Wasteland."

D.response_text: "I know of a means you may traverse the canyon."

E.response_text: "You know nothing of me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.X500!K.dialogue_text: "Biracul's balls! I've half a mind to test whether this is just idle boasting!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5000!K.dialogue_text: "You'll need more than just a mouth on you if you want to challenge the master of the Tacribian League..."

A.response_text: "I've heard of your dispute with Dazir."

D.response_text: "I could tell you what's happening on the other side of the canyon..."

E.response_text: "Half? That's 'half' more than I thought you even had."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5001!K.dialogue_text: "Biracul's balls! I've half a mind to test whether this is just idle boasting!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5002!K.dialogue_text: "You'll need more than just a mouth on you if you want to challenge the master of the Tacribian League..."

A.response_text: "I've heard of your dispute with Dazir."

D.response_text: "I know of a means you may traverse the canyon."

E.response_text: "Half? That's 'half' more than I thought you even had."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.X600!K.dialogue_text: "I don't know how it is that your mental illness has been tolerated by others, but your luck runs out here..."

A.response_text: "I'm sorry; I actually meant to ask of your dispute with Dazir."

D.response_text: "No, wait! I could tell you what's happening on the other side of the canyon!"

F.response_text: "I know some good doctors; maybe they can remove that stick up your ass..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.6000!K.dialogue_text: "I don't know how it is that your mental illness has been tolerated by others, but your luck runs out here..."

A.response_text: "I'm sorry; I actually meant to ask of your dispute with Dazir."

D.response_text: "No, wait! I know of a means you may traverse the canyon!"

F.response_text: "I know some good doctors; maybe they can remove that stick up your ass..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.101!KH.dialogue_text: "What of it? It's no business of yours, foreigner."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1010!K.dialogue_text: "Don't meddle with affairs that do not concern you."

B.response_text: "Why are you so hostile to outsiders?"

E.response_text: "Careful, Tacribian! Do not bite the only hand that can save your people..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.201!KH.dialogue_text: "And so you have come begging at my doorstep for answers?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2010!K.dialogue_text: "You've come to the wrong place, fool; you'll find no scraps of wisdom given to the truth-blind here."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2011!K.dialogue_text: "Now leave my abode, lest you wish to wander the Graylands..."

A.response_text: "Would you at least tell me why the Tacribians live on this side of the canyon?"

B.response_text: "Why are you so hostile to outsiders?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.301!KH.dialogue_text: "If your wish is to meet a quick and brutal demise, I suspect it will be soon granted out there."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.3010!K.dialogue_text: "Now, do not defile my abode with your degeneracy anymore."

B.response_text: "Why are you so hostile to outsiders?"

D.response_text: "...I have already braved the Wasteland and lived to tell the tale."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.401!KH.dialogue_text: "I have no need of spies - rumors and lies are of little use against the horrors of the Wasteland."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4010!K.dialogue_text: "Your pathetic ways and fragile mind would just be poison to us."

D.response_text: "I have already faced these horrors and lived to tell about them!"

E.response_text: "You know nothing of me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4012!K.dialogue_text: "You are referring to the Star Bridge, clearly."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.40120!.dialogue_text: "I know my fortress well and I also know that the gate on the other side has ceased to function."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.40121!.dialogue_text: "The conspicuous truths you mistake for secrets are worthless."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.40122!.dialogue_text: "Now, if you don't leave immediately, your corpse will."

D.response_text: "What will be my reward for opening the gate?"

E.response_text: "Conspicuous truths? You idiot, I revived the crystal."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.501!KH.dialogue_text: "Do you expect any Tacribian to be impressed by your empty bravado, foreigner?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5011!K.dialogue_text: "My guardians are prepared to combat the dark legions of Ur'Ruk if another Jinnwraith should rise from the abyssal pit."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5012!K.dialogue_text: "That is what true warriors are prepared for!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5013!K.dialogue_text: "So, you see child, I need fighters, not homeless pretenders."

A.response_text: "I'm eager to face these horrors in battle!"

D.response_text: "I've faced these creatures and lived to tell about them!"

E.response_text: "You know nothing about me!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.102!KH.dialogue_text: "We face the draugnir, the dead cursed by the Jinns to plague the righteous."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1020!K.dialogue_text: "Ark anointed us as her dedicated long ago, and thus, it is here that we find our nemesis."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1021!K.dialogue_text: "You, on the other hand, will find nothing but death."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1022!K.dialogue_text: "Now, Jinns take you away from me!"

A.response_text: "Accept my apology, Khlutt. I meant no offense."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.1023!K.dialogue_text: "We are all only responsible for ourselves and our tribe; whatever becomes of you, is immaterial to me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.10230!.dialogue_text: "If you are so fearful for yourself, then you are ill-suited to be this close to the Wasteland."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.10231!.dialogue_text: "Instead, you should go cower in Tambul or Dazir; only there do they tolerate the weakness of your ilk."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.10232!.dialogue_text: "Now, Jinns take you away from me!"

A.response_text: "Accept my apology, Khlutt. I meant no offense."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.202!KH.dialogue_text: "Do you think I jest when I tell you to be gone from my sight?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.2020!K.dialogue_text: "If you ask another question, I swear by Ark's honor that you shall find yourself dancing with the Jinns in the Graylands before it is answered!"

A.response_text: "Accept my apology, Khlutt. I meant no offense."

B.response_text: "What are these Jinns you speak of?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.X302!K.dialogue_text: "Loiter here any longer and you will share the fate of the Dazirans, Kharrspawn!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.402!KH.dialogue_text: "You're a fool indeed to think I cannot determine truth from falsehood."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.4020!K.dialogue_text: "The world will not mourn your passing, I'm sure."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.40221!.dialogue_text: "If the way is open, I'll use it to destroy those draug-loving Dazirans - and for your sake, you had best not remain among their number."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.40222!.dialogue_text: "Now, my tolerance for your presence is at an end."

D.response_text: "I shall endeavor to remain your friend, honorable Khlutt."

E.response_text: "I'll leave when it suits me to leave."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.502!KH.dialogue_text: "If there was anything about you worth knowing, it would have revealed itself in your actions."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5020!K.dialogue_text: "All you have done is stand here and prattle on."

A.response_text: "I didn't mean to challenge your authority; I meant no offense."

D.response_text: "I apologize, honorable Khlutt! Please forgive me!"

E.response_text: "You're asking to die; I will not disappoint you."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.5023!K.dialogue_text: "If the way is open, I will use it to destroy those dust-cursed Dazirans - and for your sake, you had best not remain among their number."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.50230!.dialogue_text: "Now, my tolerance for your presence is at an end."

D.response_text: "I shall endeavor to remain your friend, honorable Khlutt."

E.response_text: "I'll leave when it suits me to leave."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.503!KH.dialogue_text: "Now at last we understand each other..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!0.509!KH.dialogue_text: "You have made a grave error in testing my patience, Kharrspawn!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.000!KH.dialogue_text: "...So that hypocrite Pakahron sends an outsider to sue for peace..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.001!KH.dialogue_text: "Well, I won't negotiate with either of those skulking maggots and have no use for their transparent lies."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.002!KH.dialogue_text: "Either he opens the Gate of Celestial Judgment, or he will be punished along with the belly-crawling Dazirans."

A.response_text: "I may not be from around here, but it's clear that peace is preferable to war."

B.response_text: "What can be done to promote peace between Tacriba and Dazir?"

E.response_text: "I have not traveled all this way to be dismissed out of hand."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.100!KH.dialogue_text: "What do I care about the origin of the messenger when it is the message to which I object?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.1000!K.dialogue_text: "Dazir intends to send the residents of the Dawn Fortress to wander the Graylands, and as such, we are justified in doing whatever it takes to survive."

A.response_text: "Then I will pledge myself to the cause of restoring the aqueduct."

B.response_text: "Do you know the reason behind this calamity?"

E.response_text: "You want to make yourself both judge and executioner."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.2000!K.dialogue_text: "The Dawn Fortress protects the townships of Kabu, and we have most certainly upheld our sacred duty."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.2001!K.dialogue_text: "But without the water from the Daziran-controlled Wellspring, we cannot survive here."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.2002!K.dialogue_text: "The Kharrloving Dazirans have failed in their obligations to us, and for this betrayal, we will erase our would-be murderers from existence!"

A.response_text: "I pledge myself to the cause of restoring the aqueduct."

B.response_text: "Do you know the reason behind this calamity?"

E.response_text: "Your plans will only destabilize the region and harm the people, Khlutt."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.500!KH.dialogue_text: "If you prefer, I can beat your Trueflesh from your false before you are dismissed..."

A.response_text: "What if I can get the aqueduct to renew its flow of water?"

D.response_text: "Let's not be hasty! Perhaps there's just a misunderstanding between you and the Dazirans..."

E.response_text: "It is known that you intend hostilities; abandon your plans, now."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.101!KH.dialogue_text: "Restoring the water now does not right the wrong of stopping it in the first place."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.1010!K.dialogue_text: "That jinnloving Khaa will pay for his crimes with his life."

A.response_text: "This is not over; I will prevent this conflict!"

B.response_text: "Then I have learned all I can."

E.response_text: "Pray we never meet again!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.201!KH.dialogue_text: "Whether this was the result of accident or some jinninspired design is immaterial to me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.2010!K.dialogue_text: "I've never trusted that conniving Kharrspawn Khaa, nor any Daziran for that matter."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.2011!K.dialogue_text: "But now our sacred charge demands that his ghost be sent to the Graylands, for the good of the Tacribian League and for the good of Kabu itself."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.2012!K.dialogue_text: "I've dedicated my life to Kabu's defense and now that the enemies lurk within city limits, we will drive them out and restore order!"

A.response_text: "This is not over; I will prevent this conflict!"

B.response_text: "Then I have learned all I can."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.501!KH.dialogue_text: "This is no petty bid for power, you truth-blind fool!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.5010!K.dialogue_text: "You will not confuse me with that pretender mage, Khaa!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.5011!K.dialogue_text: "I have upheld my duties as expertly as an Archmage and continue to do so even with the betrayal of the other townships."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.5012!K.dialogue_text: "Now I warn you, any that attempt to destroy or obstruct us are to be dealt with summarily; Jinn, draugnir, mage, mortal, Neverborn: I do not discriminate when dealing with the enemies of Biracul!"

A.response_text: "This is not over; I will prevent this conflict!"

B.response_text: "Then I have learned all I can."

E.response_text: "Pray we never meet again!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.102!KH.dialogue_text: "How naive the folk of your homeland must be."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.X1020!.dialogue_text: "You will either have to kill that jinnspawn Khaa or me to achieve that dream, strange one... or more likely, die in the attempt."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.2020!K.dialogue_text: "And here I mistook you for a true scholar!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.2021!K.dialogue_text: "One such as you is doomed to failure... in 'all' things."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.302!KH.dialogue_text: "If you sympathize with the enemies of Biracul, you will die along with them."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.502!KH.dialogue_text: "Again, mere words and jinnwhispers, no substance."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!1.5020!K.dialogue_text: "Perhaps I would believe something you said if it were ever accompanied with action."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!9.000!KH.dialogue_text: "So, another foreigner trespassing into our domain."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!9.X001!K.dialogue_text: "Be silent. My Truesight will speak your true intentions for you."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!9.0010!K.dialogue_text: "Be silent. My Truesight will speak your true intentions for you."

D.response_text: _Use Hidden Mind Techne_

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!9.002!KH.dialogue_text: "Resist, and I will cripple your Falseflesh along with the true..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!9.004!KH.dialogue_text: "Whatever words you wished to weave deceit with would be best used to make peace with your gods..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!10.000!K.dialogue_text: "Your mind is stained! You Unseen scum!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!MAGE'S ABODE!10.001!K.dialogue_text: "You'd imitate Ormenos? Then be thorough and share his fate!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.000.dialogue_text: Eidos enters an area dominated by a large pit of cordoned-off sand. The Tacribian warriors here are seen thrusting blunt-ended spears at each other, dodging with practiced grace. The midday sun would broil their flesh were the pit not in the penumbra of the broken, yet nonetheless imposing, tower. The soldiers seems to keep their exertions brief.
