Training for but a few minutes before stopping to rest as they begin to perspire. A child walks among them dispensing small measures of water.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.001.dialogue_text: The Proving Grounds naturally lead into what seems to be the central space of the Fortress complex, this a large courtyard through which soldiers come and go. At the edge of the courtyard is a tremendous, black iron gate, which is in turn dwarfed by the unfathomably large bulwark in which it is embedded.\n\n\t\tHowever, looking away from the courtyard reveals an area that looks to be an amphitheater of some kind. Beside it, a massive dome sits beneath the end of the Tacribian aqueduct, drier than the desert sand surrounding it.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.000.dialogue_text: Eidos stands in the proving grounds of the Dawn Fortress. The sounds of bodies striking the sand and grunts of exertion ring loudly from the pit itself. But from the sidelines, the eyes of many exhausted warriors lock upon her with glowers of suspicion. Yet these are quickly distracted when the water bearers finally reach them - not even their battle-hardened faces are capable of masking their dire thirst.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.X00.dialogue_text: There are three people of note, all are armed with spears - real or practice. One is a man standing watch over all with a stoic countenance; he occasionally grunts out instructions. Another is woman armed with a practice spear, drilling her strange spearcraft. And lastly, there is a man who seems to be arguing with himself or perhaps his spear.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0099..dialogue_text: Before the Tacribian warrior can succumb to injuries, a look of proud determination falls upon a point behind Eidos. Turning about, she sees that summons unheard have called forth the master of this fortress. The sinewy frame of Khlutt, commander of the Tacribian League, now silently glides into the Proving Grounds.

Moving with a feline grace, the rhythmic click of the mage's hobnail sandals upon sand mark the time as he paces a circle about her. His face has all the emotion and stability of a stone archway, yet unambiguously promises a destruction utter and absolute...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!999.X.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!999.0.dialogue_text: Other guards inspect the body of their fallen mage and shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. In clockwork unison, the warriors gather around Eidos. Wordlessly, they move, as though compelled by the unspoken directives of their slain commander, the flame of his instructions still burning brightly within them. Stone-faced, they begin their task, like a cadre of unthinking, unfeeling Neverborn automata.
One of the soldiers then crouches down at her side to begin ruthlessly packing a band of cloth down her throat. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.
Anticipation of when the air runs out.

As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.
The plurality returning to its singularity.
The warriors somberly sing a mournful dirge for their fallen leader as they witness Eidos' departure from the Falseflesh, knowing she will now go to do battle with Khlutt in the Graylands...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.000.dialogue_text: "I can't believe we sit here idly while our water supply dwindles to nothing!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.001.dialogue_text: "All children of Biracul would surely agree that Khlutt is a weak leader to have led the Tacribian League to such a fate!"

A.response_text: "What course of action would you recommend?"

D.response_text: "What is Khlutt planning?"

E.response_text: "And yet you serve him... What does this say about you?"

F.response_text: "Yeah, I know."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.100.dialogue_text: "I have no access to an endless font of Awareness!"
"Further, it is not my responsibility to find a path out of this calamity."
"I am simply saying that Khlutt is a weak mage, and that he should have never allowed this to happen."

A.response_text: "Perhaps no mage could have avoided such a problem."

B.response_text: "How is he weak for being incapable of crossing an impassable canyon?"

E.response_text: "One who acts is stronger than one who complains about the actions of others."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.200.dialogue_text: "The fact that he would guide our people into a predicament that could very well kill us is evidence enough of his weakness!"
"No mage before has led our people into such a catastrophic situation."
"I therefore proclaim, with exalted Ark as my witness, that Khlutt is the weakest of all magi!"

A.response_text: "Perhaps no mage could have avoided such a problem."

B.response_text: "How is he weak for being incapable of crossing an impassable canyon?"

C.response_text: "You sound like you know what you are talking about."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.300.dialogue_text: "The fact that he would guide our people into a predicament that could very well kill us is evidence enough of his weakness!"
"No mage before this has led our people into such a catastrophic situation."
"I therefore proclaim, with exalted Ark as my witness, that Khlutt is the weakest of all magi!"

B.response_text: "How is he weak for being incapable of crossing an impassable canyon?"

C.response_text: "You sound like you know what you are talking about."

D.response_text: "Are you suggesting he needs to be removed from power?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.400.dialogue_text: "I think it's pretty clear he has no plans!"
"If he did, then why are the forces of the Dawn Fortress sitting idle?"
"Such is the nature of Khlutt's weakness as a leader!"
"Despite having dealt with the Dazirans for years, he had no preparations for an event like this; and now, we might very well all perish because of his jinnlicking ineptitude! Pardon my language."

C.response_text: "You sound like you know what you are talking about."

D.response_text: "Are you suggesting he needs to be removed from power?"

E.response_text: "One who acts is stronger than one who complains about the actions of others."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.500.dialogue_text: "I am a loyal and devout follower of Ark and of the traditions of the Tacribian League."
"But Khlutt is a mage-leader; it is his responsibility to ensure the safety and prosperity of those whom he commands."
"Yet his weakness has left him incapable of carrying out his responsibility."

A.response_text: "Perhaps no mage could have avoided such a problem."

D.response_text: "Are you suggesting he needs to be removed from power?"

E.response_text: "One who acts is stronger than one who complains about the actions of others."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.600.dialogue_text: "The fact that he would guide our people into a predicament that could very well kill us is evidence enough of his weakness!"
"No mage before this has led our people into such a catastrophic situation."
"I therefore proclaim, with exalted Ark as my witness, that Khlutt is the weakest of all magi!"

B.response_text: "How is he weak for being incapable of crossing an impassable canyon?"

C.response_text: "You sound like you know what you are talking about."

F.response_text: "Look, I get it."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.101.dialogue_text: "Ark stood in defiance of foes far greater than that of Khaa and the Dazirans!"
"Furthermore, she did nothing to bring on the horrors of the Jinnwraith Rikharr and his draugnir army."
"Yet still, she was able to launch a counter-offensive that broke their forces."
"Khlutt, on the other hand, has had years of interactions with Khaa and yet still he did not foresee this event!"

A.response_text: "How do you think Ark would get across the canyon?"

B.response_text: "I thought you said he was weak, not lacking in foresight?"

E.response_text: "So you know of Khlutt's situation? Am I to believe you are his confidant?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.201.dialogue_text: "A strong mage would be able to surmount the mere span of Heaven's Bridge, without a doubt."
"Ark was faced with far sterner odds in her time, but she prevailed due to the fact that she was a strong mage!"
"Yet, Khlutt was not able to make Khaa and the Dazirans fear him sufficiently."
"Furthermore, he did not foresee this obvious outcome!"

A.response_text: "How do you think Ark would get across the canyon?"

B.response_text: "I thought you said he was weak, not lacking in foresight?"

C.response_text: "It is true; you need a strong leader."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.301.dialogue_text: "Not really; I am but a simple and perfectly humble guardian of Kabu."
"I merely wish we had a leader that was capable of allowing us to fulfill our duty."
"However, now I will solemnly reflect more upon this."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.401.dialogue_text: "I do not know who would make a good leader!"
"Most certainly if a humble guardian such as myself were to be the commander of the Tacribian League, things would undoubtedly be worse!"
"But we need a strong leader, one with the ingenuity of the Emerald Architect, Biracul forgive me for the comparison! But one with such ingenuity to find a way to resolve this issue!"

C.response_text: "It is true; you need a strong leader."

D.response_text: "I thought you said he was weak, not lacking in ingenuity?"

E.response_text: "What is your evidence for your claims?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.501.dialogue_text: "I never claimed I was stronger than Khlutt!"
"I am merely saying that he is a weak leader!"
"I am not a mage and it is not up to me to come up with an ingenious plan."
"You have offered no evidence that Khlutt is not a weak leader, outlander; whereas, my argument is as flawless as it is unassailable."

A.response_text: "How do you think Ark would get across the canyon?"

D.response_text: "I thought you said he was weak, not lacking in ingenuity?"

E.response_text: "I do not have to; you are the one who is making claims."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.601.dialogue_text: "Think about it! A strong mage would be able to conquer the span of Heaven's Bridge!"
"Ark was faced with far sterner odds in her time, but she prevailed due to the fact that she was a strong mage."
"Yet, Khlutt was not able to make Khaa and the Dazirans fear him sufficiently. Further, he did not foresee this most obvious outcome."

F.response_text: "Riiiiiiiiiiiiight... Hey, I think it's time for me to..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.102.dialogue_text: "I do not know how Ark would have solved this problem!"
"I am not a great mage-leader, hero or a historian, and I never claimed that I was!"
"I am not Khalil, prescriber of the Edicts of the Tacribian League; nor am I Ammar, true designer of the Dawn Fortress."
"But these magi were able to achieve their goals and Khlutt has not; therefore, Khlutt is clearly a weaker leader!"
"I do not think this point is so difficult to understand; by Biracul's beard, even a jinnstruck plains-dweller could see that it is self-evident."

A.response_text: "I hear nothing in your diatribe that elucidates Khlutt's mistakes."

E.response_text: "A shame your words cannot become water: Tacriba would never thirst again."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.202.dialogue_text: "But that is exactly what I meant!"
"That quality is what makes a mage strong!"
"I am sorry if that you failed to understand this at the outset, but a strong leader is a wise leader."

"Ark was faced with the onslaught of the Jinnwraith Rikharr and his draugnir legions, but she destroyed them; Khalil had the diplomatic skill to prescribe the Edicts of the Tacribian League; Ammar had the intellect to design the Dawn Fortress."
"However, Khlutt has not been capable of achieving his goals; and therefore, Khlutt is clearly a weaker leader!"
"I do not think this point is so difficult to understand; by Biracul's beard, even a truth-blind plains-dweller could attest to its veracity."

A.response_text: "I hear nothing in your diatribe that elucidates Khlutt's mistakes."

C.response_text: "You know much of the history of this land it seems."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.302.dialogue_text: "I hope we will find such a leader before it is too late."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.X30.dialogue_text: "May Ark watch over us all! Farewell, outlander."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.402.dialogue_text: "Can't you see that is exactly what I meant?!"
"It is that very quality that makes a mage strong!"
"I am sorry if this obvious fact was not known to you, but a strong leader is an ingenious leader."

"Ark was faced with the onslaught of the Jinnwraith Rikharr and his draugnir legions, but she destroyed them; Khalil had the diplomatic skill to prescribe the Edicts of the Tacribian League; Ammar had the intellect to design the Dawn Fortress."
"However, Khlutt has not been capable of achieving his goals; and therefore, Khlutt is clearly a weaker leader!"
"I do not think this point is so difficult to understand; by Biracul's beard, even a draugnir could clearly see this."

C.response_text: "You know much of the history of this land it seems."

D.response_text: "Are these even analogous situations?"

E.response_text: "A shame your words cannot become water; Tacriba would never thirst again."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.502.dialogue_text: "I do not need to know Khlutt's secrets!"
"If you had knowledge of Tacribian history, it would be clear to you we have had a plethora of leaders who were more capable than he is."

"Ark was faced with the onslaught of the Jinnwraith Rikharr and his draugnir legions, but she destroyed them; Khalil had the diplomatic acumen to prescribe the Edicts of the Tacribian League; Ammar had the insight to design the Dawn Fortress."
"Yet, Khlutt has not been capable of achieving his goals; and therefore, Khlutt is clearly a weaker leader!"
"I do not think this point is so difficult to understand; by Biracul's beard, even a jinnstruck plains-dweller could see that it is self-evident."

A.response_text: "I hear nothing in your diatribe elucidate Khlutt's mistakes."

D.response_text: "Are these even analogous situations?"

E.response_text: "A shame your words cannot become water; Tacriba would never thirst again."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.602.dialogue_text: "Trust me, if you had the knowledge I possess of Tacribian history, it would be clear to you we have had a plethora of leaders who were more capable than he is."

"Ark was faced with the onslaught of the Jinnwraith Rikharr and his draugnir legions, but she destroyed them; Khalil had the diplomatic acumen to prescribe the Edicts of the Tacribian League; Ammar had the insight to design the Dawn Fortress."
"But Khlutt? No, he has not been capable of achieving his goals; and therefore, Khlutt is clearly a weaker leader!"
"I do not think this point is so difficult to understand; by Biracul's beard, even a draugnir could see this."

F.response_text: "Please... I beg of you... Kill me now... Anything to make it stop..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.203.dialogue_text: "What is happening here is nothing new!"
"Khlutt's weaknesses are directly comparable to the strengths of his predecessors; and, naturally, we judge our leaders based on their success!"
"On Ark's honor, I have been stating from the beginning that a strong mage is a successful mage."
"Khlutt is not a successful mage; ergo, it naturally follows, then, that he is not strong!"

A.response_text: "Perhaps Khlutt has a solution he has yet to reveal."

D.response_text: "So what, specifically, can he do to be strong in your eyes?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.303.dialogue_text: "Ha! It is nothing! Merely a hobby of mine."
"I suppose I must have been blessed by Biracul with a gift for such activity; surely I would make a fine Librarian! Doubtless a better one than that weakling Logira!"
"You would do no wrong to emulate my diligence, outlander."
"I suggest you go to the Archives to better prepare for our next conversation!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.503.dialogue_text: "By Biracul's beard! Don't lash out with your insults at me!"
"You asked for reasons why I believe Khlutt is weak!"
"Do not blame me for attempting to bring sight to the truth-blind!"

D.response_text: "So what, specifically, can he do to be strong in your eyes?"

E.response_text: "Yet, you continue to serve him dutifully."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.603.dialogue_text: "What is happening here is nothing new!"
"But it is clear that Khlutt's weaknesses are directly comparable to the strengths of his predecessors; and we judge them based on their success."
"As I have been stating from the very beginning: a strong mage is a successful mage; and Khlutt is not a successful mage."

F.response_text: "Somebody! Anybody! Help me! Make it stop!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.304.dialogue_text: "I apologize, my friend; I admit that I am too well-trained in the Biraculian art of debate for my own good, at times!"
"I hope you will forgive me if I exhausted you."
"You made a good effort, especially for one so clearly new to the pursuits of logic and contemplation."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.X89.dialogue_text: "I do wish we had a leader who was strong enough to ensure our survival and allow us to fulfill our sacred duty as guardians of Kabu!"
"I hope we will find such a leader, before it is too late."
"Though I do hope you are reading up on your Kaban history, so that you are more prepared next time!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.000.dialogue_text: "What is it you want, strange one? Looking to join the League?"

A.response_text: "No, actually I wish only to learn about the Tacribian people."

B.response_text: "I came to learn about the Dawn Fortress."

D.response_text: "And the reward for joining you would be...?"

E.response_text: "I don't take orders; I give them."

F.response_text: "That depends... Will I get to wear armor that accentuates my... assets?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.100.dialogue_text: "Tacribian people are not born of blood, but of the spirit."
"We are those who have chosen to protect Kabu from the enemies that would thwart the designs of Biracul."
"I myself am Daziran born, but I have made the defense of Kabu my life's work!"

A.response_text: "Do you wish to return there someday?"

B.response_text: "So fighters were part of Biracul's design?"

E.response_text: "And what have your bullshit ideals yielded? Betrayal and thirst."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.200.dialogue_text: "The fortress was faceless stone before the will of humanity shaped it."
"You would do well to remember that the true form of the Dawn Fortress is not stone and mortar but the people who protect it!"
"I myself was born to Daziran parents, but so too was I redirected to serve something of far greater importance than myself or my family."

B.response_text: "So fighters were part of Biracul's design?"

C.response_text: "Maybe there is nothing beyond the self."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.300.dialogue_text: "Not certain? It's no wonder, because you are alone, all thoughts and deeds focused on an empty self."
"A human's true nature is to direct their will and effort to something outside of themselves; and none embody this more than those in the Tacribian League."

B.response_text: "So fighters were part of Biracul's design?"

C.response_text: "Perhaps my nature is to be alone."

D.response_text: "I see... So servitude is the key to freedom, then is it?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.400.dialogue_text: "Your reward would be deliverance from this shadow of a life you lead."
"As it stands you are alone, all thoughts and deeds focused on an empty self."
"A human's true nature is to direct their will and effort to something outside of themselves, a greater good!"
"None embody this more than those in the Tacribian League."

C.response_text: "Perhaps my nature is to be alone."

D.response_text: "I see... So servitude is the key to freedom, then is it?"

E.response_text: "And what have your bullshit ideals yielded? Betrayal and thirst."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.500.dialogue_text: "Then you speak in truth-blindness; for all things serve something beyond themselves."
"I was born to Dazir, where even the learned artisans serve their mage; and before the Great Awakening, the Neverborn served the Vanquished."
"Seeking independence is like chasing a Jinn in the windswept Waste: a truly fruitless endeavor."

A.response_text: "Do you wish to return to Dazir?"

D.response_text: "I see. Servitude is the key to freedom?"

E.response_text: "And what have your bullshit ideals yielded? Betrayal and thirst."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.600.dialogue_text: "...I believe the will of the wearer matters far more than whatever 'assets' they may wish to accentuate."

F.response_text: "But surely, a killer bod is the first step towards combat mastery!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.101.dialogue_text: "Why would I? Dazir is lost in an illusion of independence."
"If they do not awaken from this dream, they might have to be killed in their sleep."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.X10.dialogue_text: "Take care you do not share a bed with the traitors to Biracul, outlander."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.201.dialogue_text: "Biracul wished for Kabu to survive and the League is necessary to accomplish this."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.X20.dialogue_text: "Look, if you just want to wrangle about frivolous points of logic, go see if the Daziran traitors will open their doors to you."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.301.dialogue_text: "I pray to Biracul and Ark that you awaken to the truth, because solitude truly is a punishment worse than death."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.401.dialogue_text: "There are many like you, refusing to see the truth."
"Perhaps you will awaken before it is too late..."
"Though I suppose Old Famlaz would sooner convert to the Path of Awareness."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.X40.dialogue_text: "Ark keep you from the Jinn's embrace, outlander."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.501.dialogue_text: "Indeed, though as you stand, friendless and unwanted, at least you'll never be betrayed..."
"Without friends you can only have enemies; your ideals also seem pretty harrowing now don't they?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.X60.dialogue_text: "Jinns take you, outlander! Do not make light of the gravity of duty, lest you fall into the Jinn's embrace! Now off with you!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.X89.dialogue_text: "Do not threaten the will of Biracul, outlander, and no harm will come to you here."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.X90.dialogue_text: "Put some backbone into, you limp-wristed jinnlickers!"
"Hmph... Korsala, you and your Shariken rest and take your water rations!"
"What are you still lurking about for, outlander?!"
"Slow is smooth and smooth is fast, young'ns!"
"Muscles get tired, bones don't! Use your structure to support the weight!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.000.dialogue_text: "How can you handle yourself in combat, stranger? You look pretty weak to me..."

A.response_text: "I fight well enough to have survived this long."

D.response_text: "Appearances can be deceiving..."

E.response_text: "Then it will be extra humiliating when I kick your teeth down your throat."

F.response_text: "Have you ever heard of Ryu?! Dhalsim?! Bruce Lee?!! Elvis?!!!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.100.dialogue_text: "That may well be, but I doubt you've braved the Wasteland; that's the 'truest' proving ground."
"Only the Tacribians venture there, and even we sometimes never return."

A.response_text: "Perhaps we'll go there together one day."

B.response_text: "What lies in the Wasteland that is so dangerous?"

E.response_text: "What would you know of my travels, Tacribian? I have withstood death itself."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.200.dialogue_text: "Biracul's balls! Then you're as witless as you're defenseless!"
"This world isn't safe, and now that you've crossed the bridge, it's entirely deadly."
"A weak one like you should steer clear of it."

A.response_text: "Perhaps we could go there together one day."

B.response_text: "What lies in the Wasteland that is so dangerous?"

C.response_text: "It sounds perilous, indeed; I'll heed your counsel."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.300.dialogue_text: "Look, outlander, people far stronger than you've gone into the Wasteland with a lifetime of training, and when death came for 'em, it was a mercy..."
"Well, that's if it came at all."

B.response_text: "What lies in the Wasteland that is so dangerous?"

C.response_text: "It sounds perilous, indeed; I'll heed your counsel."

D.response_text: "What must one do to survive it?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.400.dialogue_text: "Not so deceptive as that, I'll wager; you speak as though truth-blind."
"Just know that nothing awaits one such as you in the Wasteland - other than the agony and death of the wraithglow, that is."

C.response_text: "It sounds perilous, indeed; I'll heed your counsel."

D.response_text: "What must one do to survive it?"

E.response_text: "I've passed through death already, Tacribian; so peddle your horror stories elsewhere."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.500.dialogue_text: "Ha! Indeed, perhaps you should try, you jinnstruck fool!"
"You could use some training if you've any hope of withstanding the horrors of the Wastes."
"You'd be lucky indeed to encounter a creature there as weak as me."
"Mark my words outlander, you'll dance with the Jinns in the Graylands if you go out into the Wastes..."
"That's if the Wastes don't swallow your Trueflesh with the wraithglow first."

A.response_text: "Perhaps we will go there together one day."

D.response_text: "What must one do to survive it?"

E.response_text: "I have passed through death already, Tacribian."

F.response_text: "What?! They're only the best fighters in history... And they suck compared to me!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.101.dialogue_text: "Ark must be rolling around in her grave laughing herself to a second death after hearing that! Pffthaha!"
"But, no, ha, I don't think we'll be going together."
"Any day now, we'll march upon the Kharrlovers of Dazir and make 'em go the way of the Vanquished."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.X10.dialogue_text: "And hopefully they'll not rise again like the draugnir from the Unseen.."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.201.dialogue_text: "Do you jest? The draugnir, of course."
"We've yet to uncover their origins, but it is whispered that they're fallen Unseen, risen from the Black Pit and come to take their vengeance upon the living."
"Take care you don't find yourself west of the beacon, or you too'll know the horrors of the Wastes, foreigner."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.301.dialogue_text: "And you'd be wise to do so."
"If the sand and the winds didn't take you, the draugnir would."
"And who's to say, you might even meet the Rubied Jinn himself!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.X30.dialogue_text: "The world's a harsh place, so guard yourself, strange one."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.401.dialogue_text: "You don't; not unless you're among the numbers of the draugnir or the Jinns."
"It's said that the Adarin once tracked a mage he wanted to kill to the lost city of Ur'Ruk, but he was never the same."
"After that, he disappeared into the Crescent Canyon, never to come back..."
"Odd, seeing as how he had just finally returned home after years of Wayfaring to the north!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.X40.dialogue_text: "Guard yourself, strange one; the brilliant countenance of Biracul does not watch over the Wastes."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.501.dialogue_text: "Hmm... I won't call you a liar, but I'll say this much: the dangers of the Wasteland go beyond death."
"Believe what you want, foreigner; do what you want; it makes no difference to me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.X50.dialogue_text: "We Tacribians were charged with the task of guarding Kabu against the Wastes, not guarding outlanders from their own draug-brained fantasies."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.601.dialogue_text: "Wouldn't that make them not the best...?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.X60.dialogue_text: "Biracul smile upon you... even if you are jinnstruck."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.899.dialogue_text: "I need to hone my skills, since I'll very soon either be leaving for the Wastes on the next circuit or slicing up some cowardly Dazirans."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!PROVING GROUNDS!0.X89.dialogue_text: "Now make like the Wayfarer and disappear."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Approaching the Tacribian side of Heaven's Bridge, Eidos sees the shattered stump of a structure that at one time must have cast a great shadow. In bygone eras, it was surely the Moon Tower's mirror image, but now all that remains is but a miserable vestige of a broken twin. While the blackened and melted form is at present but a lowly ruin, gleaming flecks sparkling in the midday sunlight reveal the golden luster it once bore.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.0010!DESCR.dialogue_text: Her footsteps bring her closer to the singed remains, and she notices that a sandstone keep has been constructed around it. However, beyond this humble keep is a defensive fortification dwarfing the walls of the other Kaban settlements by several orders of magnitude. The fortress structure beyond the bridge is so vast, so incredibly expansive that its northern and southern edges seem to only begin where infinity ends.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.0011!DESCR.dialogue_text: Finally entering the keep proper, Eidos notices the Tacribian warriors eyeing her with dispassionate gazes, most seeming somewhat dismissive of her presence. They make no attempt to bar her entry.\n\n\t\tThe stonework all around is competently cut and mortared, albeit rough and worn. The passage through the keep here is narrow - a final choking point before stepping out onto the bridge. It looks as though there is but one way forward, yet the curving path prevents her from viewing its destination.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.X0012!DESC.dialogue_text: Eidos sees that human hands have bedecked the tower’s charred corpse with bizarre ornamentation. Spear points, arrow heads and knives have been driven into cracks in its blackened surface. Small alcoves have been hollowed out and filled with inelegantly carved objects, cups and plates.\n\n\t\tWalking around the base, Eidos sees that there is an obscure shrine of some sort: a stone effigy of a vaguely feminine form clasping a jade sword. Standing in front of the shrine is an elderly woman, her gaze expectantly locked on Eidos.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.0013!DESCR.dialogue_text: The conversation at its terminus Eidos scans her surroundings once more; however, her vision is thwarted from all sides by the high walls of this narrow pathway. Gazing up at the ruined tower, she sees a mixture of faces returning her stares. The Tacribian guards look upon her with stony expressions, while the carved figures placed in the broken structure bear looks of a mixture of ecstasy, terror, pain and contentment.\n\n\t\tWhat is clear is that there is nowhere to go but forward into the fortress complex and no one to speak with besides the elderly Minah.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!10.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: As Eidos approaches the other side of Heaven's Bridge, she sees the shattered stump of a monolithic edifice. This miserable vestige of the past is all that remains of a structure that must have cast a great shadow over the bridge at one time. While the blackened and metled form that stands before her is now but a lowly ruin, gleaming flecks sparkling in the midday sunlight reveal the golden sheen that must have complemented the silver spire of Tambul off to the west.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!10.001!DESCR.dialogue_text: As her footsteps bring her closer to singed remains, she sees that a sandstone keep has been constructed around it, in a similar fashion to the fortifications surrounding Tambul's Moon Tower. However, beyond this is a defensive fortification dwarfing the walls of the other Kaban settlements by several orders of magnitude. The fortress structure beyond is so vast, so incredibly expansive that Eidos cannot even ascertain its origin or terminus from this vantage point.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!10.002!DESCR.dialogue_text: Entering the keep, Eidos sees battle-hardened Tacribian soldiers eying her with focused glares; glares that turn to shock and indignation as they recognize the meddling foreigner they had been warned about. Springing into action, they surround her and mere moments later, the mage appears to exact Tacribian justice upon the intruder.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!77.000!DESCR.dialogue_text: Assala leads Eidos over the bridge, dashing past the ruined tower and through the narrow passage and high walls of the Keep. When the soldiers standing guard at the cusp recognize her, Assala tells of Ark's return. Several soldiers drop to their knees, prostrating themselves before Eidos, as the Valvorthr Assala had done. Others eye Eidos with great suspicion and equal measures of skepticism. Before long, one soldier runs off to alert the mage. Eidos and Assala then follow, walking briskly through the narrow confines of the Keep's pathway and into the settlement.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0099.000!DES.dialogue_text: Before the aged Tacribian warrior can succumb to her injuries, a look of proud determination falls upon a point behind Eidos. Turning about, she sees that summons unheard have called forth the master of this fortress. The sinewy frame of Khlutt, commander of the Tacribian League, now silently glides into the Sun Keep.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0099.001!DES.dialogue_text: Moving with a feline grace, the click of the mage's hobnail sandals mark the time as he paces a circle about her. His face has all the emotion and stability of a stone archway, yet unambiguously promises a destruction utter and absolute...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!999.X000!DES.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!999.001!DESC.dialogue_text: Other guards inspect the body of their fallen mage and shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. In clockwork unison, the warriors gather around Eidos. Wordlessly, they move, as though compelled by the unspoken directives of their slain commander, the flame of his instructions still burning brightly within them. Stone-faced, they begin their task, like a cadre of unthinking, unfeeling Neverborn automata.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!999.002!DESC.dialogue_text: One of the soldiers then crouches down at her side to begin ruthlessly packing a band of cloth down her throat. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!999.003!DESC.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!999.004!DESC.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!999.005!DESC.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!999.006!DESC.dialogue_text: The warriors somberly sing a mournful dirge for their fallen leader as they witness Eidos' departure from the Falseflesh, knowing she will now go to do battle with Khlutt in the Graylands...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.000!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "Come here, foreigner! This is where you can make an offering to Ark, Archmage of the victorious dead, and savior of the Valvorthr!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.0000!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Come and share communion with those that saved Kabu from the greedy maw of the Wasteland in the dark of yesteryear."

A.response_text: "Is it appropriate for me to do so?"

D.response_text: "Why is this tower in ruins?"

E.response_text: "The dead are never victorious."

F.response_text: "Sorry, but I'm already a member of several cults."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.100!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "Of course it is! Life in Kabu would be impossible without the sacrifice of Ark and the First Guardians!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.1000!MINAH.dialogue_text: "All who dwell here live in debt to those who first fought, bled and died under the banner of the Tacribian League!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.1001!MINAH.dialogue_text: "So too is it pious for those who drink of our water and rest in our townships, to pay their respects, as even now, the divine Ark slays Jinns in the Graylands, protecting those who pay tribute."

B.response_text: "So you worship Ark as a goddess?"

E.response_text: "You are fools to mistake a human for a god."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.200!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "Centuries ago, the Dawn Fortress did not exist, and the abominations of the Wasteland were kept at bay solely by the powers of the Sun and Moon Towers."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.2001!MINAH.dialogue_text: "A writhing swarm of draugnir were herded to this tower by the rancid Wasteland master, the bilious Jinnwraith."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.2002!MINAH.dialogue_text: "They smashed the Sun Tower, shredded the Falseflesh of the brave Kabans protecting and were even poised to wreak havoc upon all of Kabu proper."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.2003!MINAH.dialogue_text: "That is, until Archmage Ark and the Valvorthr, met them on Heaven's Bridge, uniting the two towers!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.2004!MINAH.dialogue_text: "She led them as a mage, but died as one of the gods."

A.response_text: "I see. How am I to pay my respects?"

B.response_text: "So you worship Ark as a goddess?"

C.response_text: "It was so long ago, it has little meaning to me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.3000!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Life in Kabu would be impossible without the sacrifice of Archmage Ark and the Valvorthr!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.3001!MINAH.dialogue_text: "All who dwell here live in debt to those who first fought, bled, and died under the banner of the Tacribian League!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.3002!MINAH.dialogue_text: "So too is it pious for those who drink of our water and rest in our townships, to pay their respects, as even now, the divine Ark slays Jinns in the Graylands, protecting those who pay tribute."

B.response_text: "So you worship Ark as a goddess?"

C.response_text: "It was so long ago, and has little meaning to me."

D.response_text: "How did Ark become so powerful?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.400!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "Centuries ago, the Dawn Fortress did not exist, and the abominations of the Wasteland were kept at bay solely by the powers of the Sun and Moon Towers."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.4001!MINAH.dialogue_text: "A writhing swarm of draugnir were herded to this tower by the rancid Wasteland master, the bilious Jinnwraith."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.4002!MINAH.dialogue_text: "They smashed the Sun Tower, shredded the Falseflesh of the brave Kabans protecting and were even poised to wreak havoc upon all of Kabu proper."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.4003!MINAH.dialogue_text: "That is, until Archmage Ark and the Valvorthr, met them on Heaven's Bridge, uniting the two towers!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.4004!MINAH.dialogue_text: "She led them as a mage, but died as one of the gods."

C.response_text: "It was so long ago, and has little meaning to me."

D.response_text: "How did Ark become so powerful?"

E.response_text: "You are fools to mistake a human for a god."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.500!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "How little you know of the world and the gods!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.5000!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Do you not know that eons ago, the draugnir swarm of the Jinnwraith made a ruin of the Sun Tower and flooded across Heaven's Bridge?!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.5001!MINAH.dialogue_text: "But Archmage Ark and her guardians carved death into the jinncursed creature's bones and cast it back into the Graylands!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.5002!MINAH.dialogue_text: "And there she followed after it, to do eternal battle against the foes of Biracul."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.5003!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Now Ark reigns over us Tacribians from the very nether regions of death."

A.response_text: "I see... How am I to pay my respects?"

D.response_text: "How did Ark become so powerful?"

E.response_text: "You are fools to mistake a human for a god."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.6000!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Life in Kabu would be impossible without the sacrifice of Archmage Ark and the First Guardians!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.6001!MINAH.dialogue_text: "All who dwell here live in debt to those who first fought, bled and died under the banner of the Tacribian League!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.6002!MINAH.dialogue_text: "So too is it pious for those who drink of our water and rest in our townships, to pay their respects, as even now, the divine Ark slays Jinns in the Graylands, protecting those who pay tribute."

F.response_text: "Well, I'm kind of strapped for cash... Can you accept a merry jig as payment?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.101!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "You need only offer your time and thought."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.1010!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Right, now come and stand here with me, before the graven image of Ark, and dedicate a mere moment of your life to the contemplation of sacrifice."

D.response_text: Pretend to contemplate

E.response_text: Leave this place

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.201!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "There are many creatures in this world, some mortal, some divine and some of both natures."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.2010!MINAH.dialogue_text: "I see you wish to understand, but be careful your mind does not fill with the poisoned wisdom of the Emerald Jinn."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.X2011!MINA.dialogue_text: "Now, if you'll excuse me, I must get back to my prayer!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.301!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps your mind has been slain by the Obsidian Jinn!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.3010!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Oh! May Ark strike the mind from your Falseflesh and Biracul fill it with the peace of Awareness."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.X3011!MINA.dialogue_text: "Now I must get back to my prayer!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.401!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "It is said she was a follower of the Old Way, and consumed the flesh of her enemies."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.4010!MINAH.dialogue_text: "But because her enemies were the Jinns themselves, she was imbued with their power."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.501!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps you have already been beguiled by the Rubied Jinn!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.601!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps you have been driven mad by the Rubied Jinn!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.103!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "I thank you for sharing this time with us."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.X104!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Ark will be watching over you, even if you should stand at the maw of the Graylands itself."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.X891!MINAH.dialogue_text: "When Biracul watches over us from the heavens and Ark from below in the Graylands, what do those such as we have to fear?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.X892!MINAH.dialogue_text: "May you who are on the path of wisdom, find Awareness in the Shining One."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!0.X899!MINAH.dialogue_text: "May Ark strike the mind from your Falseflesh and Biracul fill it with the peace of Awareness."

D.response_text: "...Drink from the Living Chalice, my sister."

E.response_text: "You worship a false god."

F.response_text: "So is Valvorthr short for something?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.1000!MINAH.dialogue_text: "But you need not be one of us to offer your thoughts to Ark; for she watches over all the faithful."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.1001!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Because, of course, death is the path we all share."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.1002!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Does it not follow then that we should need a guide on that perilous road?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.1003!MINAH.dialogue_text: "From the Wellspring to the Wasteland itself, we guide Ark's faithful to her embrace."

B.response_text: "What does the Wellspring have to do with anything?"

E.response_text: "But Ark is dead."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.200!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "Such things are rarely spoken of and are only to be revealed to the faithful at the Nattverthr."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.2000!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Though I know not what awaits us Valvorthr at the dinner, I do know it is the final meal for the chosen before they join Ark in her vigil over the Wellspring."

B.response_text: "What does the Wellspring have to do with anything?"

D.response_text: "But the Wellspring is inaccessible."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.210!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "Such things are rarely spoken of and are only to be revealed to the faithful at the Nattverthr."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.2100!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Though I know not what awaits us Valvorthr at the dinner, I do know it is the final meal for the chosen before they join Ark in her vigil over the Wellspring."

B.response_text: "I have been to the depths of the Wellspring, but Ark was not there."

D.response_text: "But the Wellspring is inaccessible."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.220!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "Such things are rarely spoken of and are only to be revealed to the faithful at the Nattverthr."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.2200!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Though I know not what awaits us Valvorthr at the dinner, I do know it is the final meal for the chosen before they join Ark in her vigil over the Wellspring."

B.response_text: "What does the Wellspring have to do with anything?"

D.response_text: "...I have traversed the Waste; Ark awaits in distant Ur'Ruk."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.230!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "Such things are rarely spoken of and are only to be revealed to the faithful at the Nattverthr."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.2300!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Though I know not what awaits us Valvorthr at the dinner, I do know it is the final meal for the chosen before they join Ark in her vigil over the Wellspring."

B.response_text: "I have been to the depths of the Wellspring, but Ark was not there."

D.response_text: "...I have traversed the Waste; Ark waits in distant Ur'Ruk."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.400!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "Can it be that an outlander has joined the ranks of Ark's chosen?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.4000!MINAH.dialogue_text: "I had not thought it possible, though I welcome it!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.4001!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Has Ark yet guided you to the Wellspring, then?"

B.response_text: "What does the Wellspring have to do with anything?"

D.response_text: "But the Wellspring is inaccessible."

E.response_text: "Ark is dead."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.410!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "Can it be that an outlander has joined the ranks of Ark's chosen?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.4100!MINAH.dialogue_text: "I had not thought it possible, though I welcome it!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.4101!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Has Ark yet guided you to the Wellspring, then?"

B.response_text: "I have been to the depths of the Wellspring, but Ark was not there."

D.response_text: "But the Wellspring is inaccessible."

E.response_text: "Ark is dead."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.4200!MINAH.dialogue_text: "I had not thought it possible, though I welcome it!"
