B.response_text: "What does the Wellspring have to do with anything?"

D.response_text: "...I have traversed the Waste; Ark waits in distant Ur'Ruk."

E.response_text: "Ark is dead and I her slayer."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.430!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "Can it be that an outlander has joined the ranks of Ark's chosen?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.4300!MINAH.dialogue_text: "I had not thought it possible, though I welcome it!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.4301!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Has Ark yet guided you to the Wellspring?"

B.response_text: "I have been to the depths of the Wellspring, but Ark was not there."

D.response_text: "...I have traversed the Waste; Ark waits in distant Ur'Ruk."

E.response_text: "Ark is dead and I her slayer."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.5000!MINAH.dialogue_text: "One that could bind the very Jinns themselves to her will!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.X5001!MINA.dialogue_text: "Yes, in fact, that is how she vanquished the Jinnwraith."

D.response_text: "I thought the Wellspring is inaccessible."

E.response_text: "But Ark was killed as well."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.5002!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Yes, in fact, that is how she vanquished the Jinnwraith."

D.response_text: "...I have traversed the Waste; Ark waits in the city of Ur'Ruk."

E.response_text: "Ark is dead by my hand."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.600!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "Why? Does it seem like an abbreviation of some sort?"

E.response_text: "But Ark is dead."

F.response_text: "No, like a mnemonic device to remember all the dynasties of the Mushroom Kingdom."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.101!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "Many see Ark so clearly in the world that the lofty form of Biracul goes unthought and unsung."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.1010!MINAH.dialogue_text: "But our failure to see him is just that: weakness."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.X1011!MINA.dialogue_text: "And yet still Biracul watches us from the Empyrean, but that Holy House, is not ours to occupy nor shall it ever be."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.201!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "You will know, when the time is right for you to know."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.X2010!MINA.dialogue_text: "For all is always as it should be."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.211!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "Fear not! Even we Valvorthr are guilty of faithlessness."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.2110!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Perhaps you traveled there, but you have yet to make the true journey."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.2111!MINAH.dialogue_text: "I do not have to walk its hallowed halls to see Ark, or to know you looked upon them with blind eyes."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.X2112!MINA.dialogue_text: " 'If the eye dislikes the world it sees, is it not easier to lose the eye than the whole world? When rains come, turn your scorn from the clouds and towards your own house. All things are as they should be.' "

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.401!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "No Daziran trickery can stand betwixt Ark and her faithful!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.X4010!MINA.dialogue_text: "Ark may have shut the Wellspring to the Dazirans, but the maw of the Graylands yawns open for us all."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.4110!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Ark stalks the lion and fights it even within its very own den!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.4111!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Did you think the sins of the Vanquished would go unanswered?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.4112!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Did you know not that she alone among magi bound the Emerald Jinn to her will?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.4113!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Our Lady's ways are not our ways, nor should they be."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.4114!MINAH.dialogue_text: " 'Curse not the bird for its flight. Instead, be thankful that through its life, we are spared such dangers.' "

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.X4115!MINA.dialogue_text: "Fear not child, all is forever as it should be."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.501!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "But child, death is not the end."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.X5010!MINA.dialogue_text: "The Graylands are but the path we must walk with Ark to build the True Temple!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.511!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "We have all of us killed Ark many times, child."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.5110!MINAH.dialogue_text: "I know that my crimes awoke the Jinnwraith from the abyssal pit! And I know that my faithlessness compelled her to face him upon Heaven's Bridge!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.5111!MINAH.dialogue_text: "It was I, just as much as it was you, who threw Ark down into the Graylands!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.5112!MINAH.dialogue_text: "Fear not, my child, we will all of us be redeemed; for our Lady watches from below, and Biracul from above!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.X5113!MINA.dialogue_text: "And all things are ever as they should be!"

F.response_text: "Yeah, but who would trust the word of a nutjob like you?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!SUN KEEP!1.800!MINAH!.dialogue_text: "Perhaps we shall one day be called to the final service in the Wellspring... but only if we listen for the voice of Ark calling from within."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.0.dialogue_text: Walking within the stone structure, Eidos is met with a vision that defies all expectations. While the exterior was a rough brown stone, the interior is lined with white limestone and brilliant marble. Several paths lead from as many doors toward a central hub, like spokes on a cart wheel. The voids between them expose the sloping floors beneath and reveals a recession into an infinitely deep spiral consumed by shadows at its depths. The dome in which she stands seems to be but the uppermost part of this inexplicable structure.\n\n\t\tAll is lit by a large aperture in the top of the dome. The rays of sunlight showering down upon the room are refracted and scattered through numerous prisms, lighting the interior with a gentle glow. A bit of sun, however, is discourteously obstructed by the terminus of the Tacribian aqueduct - dry now, but Eidos can nearly envision water cascading down from it.

Grandiose though the temple may be, it looks to be unfinished and unused. There are no decorations to speak of and seemingly no paraphernalia of worship, save one. Sitting upon a large raised platform in the middle of the room is a solitary stone chair, serving as the room’s sole furnishing. But furniture is not the only scarce resource in the room; likewise, as far as Eidos can tell, not even a single human shadow haunts the temple.

Walking around the perimeter of the central hub, Eidos notices there is a simple, but lengthy font of exceptional depth and a lone cleric lying prostrate before it in the utter silence of stillness. The font appears to have once been full of water, but is now so dry it would make the Wastes jealous.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.X.dialogue_text: Ascending the stairs carved into the platform, Eidos begins to inspect the chair. It is hewn from a monolithic piece of white quartz and would clearly be far too large and too stiff for a human to sit upon comfortably. Words have been engraved deep into the stony flesh of the chair in bold lines of grand import. However, they are indecipherable to her.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.1.dialogue_text:
Ascending the stairs carved into the platform, Eidos begins to inspect the chair. It is hewn from a monolithic piece of white quartz and would clearly be far too large and too stiff for a human to sit upon comfortably. Words have been engraved deep into the stony flesh of the chair in bold lines of grand import. Eidos then begins to read the message from the Tacribian's ancestors to their progeny:

		THE EYE AND BIRACUL, ONE CREATED MIND
		TACRIBA DAZIR TAMBUL, ONE BOUND KIND
		THE MAGE OF MAGES HERE, THE ONE TO FIND

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.X.dialogue_text: At the clicking of Eidos feet upon the marble floor, the cleric slowly rises.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.2.dialogue_text: The conversation at its terminus, Eidos is now left with a decision to make.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!009.dialogue_text: Before the Tacribian cleric can succumb to injuries, a look of proud determination falls upon a point behind Eidos. Turning about, she sees that summons unheard have called forth the master of this fortress. The sinewy frame of Khlutt, commander of the Tacribian League, now silently glides into the Temple of Biracul.

Moving with a feline grace, the click of the mage's hobnail sandals mark the time as he paces a circle about her. His face has all the emotion and stability of a stone archway, yet unambiguously promises a destruction utter and absolute...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!999.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

Other guards inspect the body of their fallen mage and shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. In clockwork unison, the warriors gather around Eidos. Wordlessly, they move, as though compelled by the unspoken directives of their slain commander, the flame of his instructions still burning brightly within them. Stone-faced, they begin their task, like a cadre of unthinking, unfeeling Neverborn automata.
One of the soldiers then crouches down at her side to begin ruthlessly packing a band of cloth down her throat. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.
Anticipation of when the air runs out.

As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.
The plurality returning to its singularity.
The warriors somberly sing a mournful dirge for their fallen leader as they witness Eidos' departure from the Falseflesh, knowing she will now go to do battle with Khlutt in the Graylands...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.0.dialogue_text: "Greetings, stranger, and welcome to Biracul's house."
"Have you come to prepare for your death?"

B.response_text: "Is this the purpose of this temple?"

D.response_text: "I don't intend on dying anytime soon!"

E.response_text: "If I were, I certainly wouldn't talk to you about it."

F.response_text: "I die all the time! So I don't really need much more practice."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.1.dialogue_text: "Did you not see the graven image of Ark upon your arrival to the fortress?"
"Where would we be if she had given up hope?"
"But she also heeded the words of Biracul, meeting her death armed with the unbreakable shield of Awareness!"

E.response_text: "I'm beyond caring about such matters; for I'm beyond death."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.2.dialogue_text: "It's a painting in stone, an artist's rendering of the Empyrean from whence Biracul looks down upon us."
"It likewise is a haven for all folk of Kabu, for whether warrior or not, we all march toward an unseen foe whom none can overcome."
"Indeed, all must prepare to die, child."
"Fortunately, we may take comfort in the words of Biracul; death for those bearing His Awareness, is no true death at all."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.3.dialogue_text: "It's not too late to begin preparing for your end, child."
"Many are those content to live on as though their life were an inexhaustible well."
"But, they can only hope death comes quietly and without warning; for they know in their heart they have not prepared themselves by gaining Awareness."

D.response_text: "What of this Biracul?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.4.dialogue_text: "No one foresees their own death, child; our eyes are so naturally dim that we cannot see what so clearly lies before us."

"Even if we find inexhaustible water, even if we defeat all our enemies, even if we outwit the very Jinns themselves, even then death is patiently waiting at the end of it all to rip our Trueflesh from the False!"
"When you see a warrior fall in battle, an old man on his deathbed or a youth taken by disease, think on them well, for we are all bound to the same fate."

D.response_text: "What of this Biracul?"

E.response_text: "I'm beyond caring about such matters; for I'm beyond death."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.5.dialogue_text: "Oh, why there's no need to speak your heart to others to prepare for death, child!"
"All you must do is commune with your own Trueflesh; and in so doing you will converse with the Shining One himself."
"And is not the Awareness given through the words of Biracul the only true path to salvation?"

D.response_text: "What of this Biracul? Is he not himself immortal?"

E.response_text: "I'm beyond caring about such matters; for I'm beyond death."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.6.dialogue_text: "So, is this belief part of your foreign religion?"
"I've heard it said that some believe death is but a doorway to another earthly life - though this is not the Awareness spoken of by Biracul."

F.response_text: "Death is just another round of backtracking through the game world."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.1.dialogue_text: " 'Humans are flawed and beautiful creatures, fiercely devouring and dying like desert wolves. But when these beings strive with the Inner Eye open, they give rise to something perfect, that which lives beyond their drying blood. Look into the void with this Eye, to see beyond it.' "

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.2.dialogue_text: " 'The Many are but a part of the One. Our experience but a shadow of the truth. Though the ant bears a lone grain of sand, the nest is a mighty creature.' "
"Your life and actions live on in the lives of others, just as your mind lives on in the heavens with Biracul."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.3.dialogue_text: "I wonder if this is just a mask for your fear..."
"May you accept the death that awaits us all."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.4.dialogue_text: "All humans are mortal, but some are created less mortal than others."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.5.dialogue_text: "Even a Jinn will not persist when the One reopens its Eye."
" 'All shadows shall be illuminated by the sight which brings forth the light of Awareness.' "

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.6.dialogue_text: "Pulling a mask of frivolity over the face of death does not unmake it."
"When you have chosen to face your doom with truth in your mind, please return here."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.X.dialogue_text: "Now, go in the light of the Shining One, may it ever illuminate your way."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.8.dialogue_text: "May Biracul watch over us from the Empyrean as we walk upon the earth!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!0.X.dialogue_text: "And may Ark protect our souls as they wander in the Graylands."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.0.dialogue_text: "Outlander, I'm curious; have you look upon our Archives yet?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.X.dialogue_text: "I see. Well, if you get a chance, you should visit; there is much to learn from the barren tree bed there."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.0.dialogue_text: "There perhaps you noticed the barren tree bed? The spot where our Muninn should be?"
"Yes, there is much history permeating that empty soil..."
"Ah, well, there is much history permeating the empty soil of that tree bed."
"You see, Elk was our Muninn, the most ancient and wise of all Muninns."
"But she was slain, leaving only us Tacribians as the lone tribe of Kabu without a sacred Muninn."

"Though many of my people have shed tears for our lost Muninn Tree - and many more would shed blood for the breaking of the covenant which would have restored it - I believe we should seek no reprisal."

D.response_text: "...Wise words, but how was the Tree destroyed?"

E.response_text: "Then you invite further insults."

F.response_text: "Been smokin' that peace pipe too, huh?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.X.dialogue_text: "When Ysmaz refused to recognize the mantle of Archmage, he not only stole away our destiny as the center of a new Kabu, but condemned us to a life without a living memory."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.1.dialogue_text: "Is it not strange? To think that the present and future can so precariously hang upon the past..."

A.response_text: "That's why we need kith and kin."

B.response_text: "It's true; we are nothing without awareness."

E.response_text: "Even without my past, I'm still myself."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.1.dialogue_text: "When Ysmaz refused to recognize the mantle of Archmage, he not only stole away our destiny as the center of a new Kabu, but condemned us to a life without a living memory."
"Is it not strange? To think that the present and future can so precariously hang upon the past..."

A.response_text: "If it's the tree near Old Tacriba, then I've actually revived it."

B.response_text: "It's true; we are nothing without awareness."

E.response_text: "Even without my past, I'm still myself."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.X.dialogue_text: "The covenant stated that the tree growing in Tambul, a sapling of the great Elk itself, would be uprooted just as we were, and placed under our care."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.2.dialogue_text: "But with Ysmaz the Covenant-Breaker, we were condemned to a life without a living memory."
"Is it not strange? To think that the present and future can so precariously hang upon the past..."

A.response_text: "That's why we need kith and kin."

B.response_text: "It's true; we are nothing without awareness."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.2.dialogue_text: "The covenant stated that the tree growing in Tambul, a sapling of the great Elk itself, would be uprooted just as we were, and placed under our care."
"But with Ysmaz the Covenant-Breaker, we were condemned to a life without a living memory."
"Is it not strange? To think that the present and future can so precariously hang upon the past..."

A.response_text: "That's why we need kith and kin."

B.response_text: "If it's the tree near Old Tacriba, then I've actually revived it."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.X.dialogue_text: "I wish it were so. But with Ysmaz the Covenant-Breaker, we were condemned to a life without a living memory."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.3.dialogue_text: "Is it not strange? To think that the present and future can so precariously hang upon the past..."

B.response_text: "It's true; we are nothing without awareness."

D.response_text: "I suppose it's unwise to trust anyone."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.3.dialogue_text: "I wish it were so. But with Ysmaz the Covenant-Breaker, we were condemned to a life without a living memory."
"Is it not strange? To think that the present and future can so precariously hang upon the past..."

B.response_text: "If it's the tree near Old Tacriba, then I've actually revived it."

D.response_text: "I suppose it's unwise to trust anyone."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.X.dialogue_text: "Some say it was unmade by the Emerald Jinn; still other accounts name the Jinnwraith himself as Elk's slayer."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.4.dialogue_text: "Regardless, it was without a doubt a Kaban mage that condemned us to a life without a living memory: Ysmaz, Covenant-Breaker."
"Is it not strange? To think that the present and future can so precariously hang upon the past..."

D.response_text: "That's precisely why you cannot trust anyone."

E.response_text: "Even without my past, I'm still myself."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.4.dialogue_text: "Some say it was unmade by the Emerald Jinn; still other accounts name the Jinnwraith himself as Elk's slayer."
"Regardless, it was without a doubt a Kaban mage that condemned us to a life without a living memory: Ysmaz, Covenant-Breaker."
"Is it not strange? To think that the present and future can so precariously hang upon the past..."

D.response_text: "If it's the tree near Old Tacriba, then I've actually revived it."

E.response_text: "Even without my past, I'm still myself."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.X.dialogue_text: "The way of Biracul is a circle, but the path of Jinns is a spiral into an unending void etched in sin."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.5.dialogue_text: "But the unbroken circle is clearly the higher truth."
"Have you not wondered how it is that the present, past and future each hang upon the other?"

A.response_text: "That's exactly why we need kith and kin."

D.response_text: "Clearly that's why you cannot trust anyone."

E.response_text: "Even without my past, I'm remain unchanged."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.5.dialogue_text: "The way of Biracul is a circle, but the path of Jinns is a spiral into an unending void etched in sin."
"But the unbroken circle is clearly the higher truth."
"Have you not wondered how it is that the present, past and future each hang upon the other?"

A.response_text: "That's exactly why we need kith and kin."

D.response_text: "Clearly that's why you cannot trust anyone."

E.response_text: "I was the one who restored that Tree, so spare me your lectures on truth."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.X.dialogue_text: "If you refer to incense, we do not use it in this space..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.6.dialogue_text: "No, I was referring to the fact that when Ysmaz refused to recognize the mantle of Archmage, he not only stole away our destiny as the center of a new Kabu, but also condemned us to a life without a living memory."
"Is it not strange? To think that the present and future can so precariously hang upon the past..."

D.response_text: "Isn't this why you cannot trust anyone?"

E.response_text: "Even without my past, I remain unaltered."

F.response_text: "Nah. I learned all about this back in '85."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.6.dialogue_text: "If you refer to incense, we do not use it in this space..."

"No, I was referring to the fact that when Ysmaz refused to recognize the mantle of Archmage, he not only stole away our destiny as the center of a new Kabu, but also condemned us to a life without a living memory."
"Is it not strange? To think that the present and future can so precariously hang upon the past..."

D.response_text: "If it's the tree near Old Tacriba, then I've actually revived it."

E.response_text: "Even without my past, I remain unaltered."

F.response_text: "Nah. I learned all about this back in '85."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.1.dialogue_text: "I see that Biracul works his will even among outlanders."
"Forgive me; I was a vain fool to have doubted it."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.X.dialogue_text: "May the Shining One light both our paths."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.3.dialogue_text: "You remind me of someone that once lived here long ago..."
"I know not what became of him, though I pray always that Biracul received his soul... and I shall do the same for you."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.4.dialogue_text: "Oh, no! We must never allow ourselves to think that."
"Discord and mistrust, that is the will of the Jinns!"
"Both Biracul and the shades of the Vanquished use this realm as their Proving Ground."
"Take heart that you do not learn the wrong lessons from your hardships."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.6.dialogue_text: "I see in you a woman as lost as we once were."
"Take heart, for you will your own way."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.8.dialogue_text: "May Biracul watch over us from the Empyrean as we walk upon the earth."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.X.dialogue_text: "May Ark protect our souls as they wander the Graylands."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.9.dialogue_text: "The lies of the Jinnwraith have no power here!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!1.X.dialogue_text: "Now, begone, death-drinker; the way to the Empyrean is shut to you!"
"Biracul, Biracul, keep me from the Jinns' influence.\n\t\tBiracul, Biracul, lead me to the path of righteous.\n\t\tBiracul, Biracul, may you illuminate our way, as you did with Ark against Rikharr."
"Unity above all else unto the singularity,\n\t\tthat we may see in others ourselves,\n\t\tand reach ever closer to Conscientia!"

A.response_text: "It's the one in the underground building, right?"

B.response_text: "I revived a tree underground; maybe it's the same one."

D.response_text: "Oh, but I do not! Your tree lives again!"

E.response_text: "Are you an idiot? I have no intention of repeating myself."

F.response_text: "Do I look like a jester to you, bro!?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!2.0.dialogue_text: "Then... You have truly been in the Sanctuary of Old Tacriba... Biracul be praised, if it be true!"
"You will taunt this faithful servant of the Shining One's no longer!"

F.response_text: "Sheesh! I don't even have a bell-studded cap or anything!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!2.0.dialogue_text: "Indeed, what you say is true, but I..."

F.response_text: "Here I was trying cheer you up with this good news, but you repay my kindness with injury!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!2.0.dialogue_text: "You misunderstand! I meant no offense... I just..."

F.response_text: "Maybe I never should have resurrected that stupid tree in the Sanctuary after all!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!2.0.dialogue_text: "But if you did resurrect the slain Muninn, there must have been a tome remaining within!"
"Oh, please, outlander! Share with me the wisdom of our forefathers! What knowledge was lost to us?"

A.response_text: "I got the impression it was about cooperation, as Biracul would have wanted."

B.response_text: "It was a historical text apparently unrelated to Kabu."

D.response_text: "...How much is it worth to you?"

E.response_text: "That you don't know, means you haven't earned it."

F.response_text: "They said we all die at the end of the book... curse those ancestor bastards!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!2.2.dialogue_text: "...Now I see... You test me! I know your mind!"
"Biracul will suck your jinnvenom from my Trueflesh!"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!2.3.dialogue_text: "...Are you sure, not even a hint of a memory as to what it was about..?"

B.response_text: "I think it was a historical text unrelated to Kabu."

D.response_text: "Perhaps an equal exchange would jog my memory..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!2.3.dialogue_text: "...Of course, I apologize for pressuring you to recall that which you do not know."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!2.X.dialogue_text: "Now, go in peace with Biracul, child."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!2.4.dialogue_text: "Well, I know the answer: the knowledge I need is already with me."
"I simply have been so desperate to see it that I let my fear get its claws into my Trueflesh."
"Thank you, for shining the light of Awareness upon me once more, outlander."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!2.5.dialogue_text: "Perhaps I was too arrogant to think I was worthy of such knowledge."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!TEMPLE OF BIRACUL!2.6.dialogue_text: "...Of course, we all must die and our ancestors too must have wanted us to accept this."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.X000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Ascending the stairway, Eidos alights atop the high walls of the Dawn Fortress. Looking out from the ramparts, the deathly visage of the Wasteland sears itself into her mind. The immediate area is unrelentingly bleak, with drifting dunes and blowing sand the dominant sights. However, the distant horizon makes no promises of what lies at its edge; it even seems to be fading from view, from memory, and even from the very fabric of reality.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.0000!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: A haze of shimmering light ripples upon the air. Barely revealed vistas swirl in and out of perception. Whether the ever-shifting shapes be structures, mountains or some other bizarre and twisted feature is impossible to determine, as fixing her gaze on a single point fails to coax the distant dancing visions to coalesce into a definitive form.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.0001!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: With a subtle shiver and a shake of her head, Eidos breaks the enthralling influence of the Wastes. Looking about, she notices that she is not alone here. An armed woman stands a short way off, her gaze spellbound to that uninviting expanse of land stretched out before them. However, her eyes are brimming with tragic purpose; they refuse to alter their course and will only ever be directed toward the northeast.\n\n\t\tEidos turns her gaze to where this warrior's eyes fall. There, pearly pillars jut from the sands like a thousand skeletal fingers clawing through their burial mounds.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.0002!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: But Eidos soon brings her attention back to the woman herself. Hardened by sights unmentionable, tested by trials unbearable, yet retaining an unmistakable grace in spite of this. Eidos' eyes leave the foreground and sharpen their focus of what lies beyond the Wasteland-obsessed warrior: a passage of stairs toward the southern end of the wall leads down into the fortress wall itself.

A.response_text: Descend the stairs to the Amphitheater

B.response_text: Descend the stairs leading into the wall

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.0005!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Ascending the stairway, Eidos alights atop the high walls of the Dawn Fortress. Looking out from the ramparts, the deathly visage of the Wasteland burns itself into her mind. The immediate area is unrelentingly bleak, with drifting dunes and blowing sand the dominant sights. However, the horizon promises some other land mass. A haze of shimmering light ripples upon the air.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.0006!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Barely revealed vistas swirl in and out of perception. Whether the ever-shifting shapes be structures, mountains or some other bizarre and twisted feature is impossible to determine - as fixing her gaze on a single point fails to coax the distant dancing visions to coalesce into a definitive form.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.0007!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Looking about, Eidos sees that she is now utterly alone here. Fwayya, who was once gazed purposefully off toward the northeast, has already departed on her fateful journey into the Wastes. But not all has abandoned Eidos upon these walls, as the familiar passage of stairs toward the southern end of the wall leading to the Archives remains accessible.

A.response_text: Descend the stairs to the Amphitheater

B.response_text: Descend the stairs leading into the wall

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.X001!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Eidos approaches the Tacribian warrior. Though aware of Eidos' presence, the woman speaks without shifting her gaze from the northeast.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.X0010!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: The conversation now over, both Eidos and Fwayya stare off into the distance in mirrored silences. The irreverent winds, however, loudly howl at the fortress gates, while the sun roasts the horizon, and in between them, the sands shift peacefully from dune to wretched dune in the grip of lifelessness. The Tacribian warrior seems to be attracted and bound to the inimical Wastes by some unseen and irresistible force, surely more so than sanity would ever permit.

A.response_text: Take a final look and then leave

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.0011!DESCRIPT.dialogue_text: Fwayya at last turns around, nods sullenly and begins her descent toward the Amphitheater. Though her facade may be strong and independent, the innocent honesty of her eyes betrays immeasurable sadness.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.100!DESCRIPTI.dialogue_text: Eidos stands atop the walls of the Dawn Fortress looking off into the distance one last time. A temporary focusing of the vapors and stilling of the winds reveals a clearer picture. Far off to the east is a structure leading down into a valley of some sort. To the southeast a shining black crater belches mephitic fumes. And scanning back toward the northeast she sees a forest of symmetrically arranged pillars of the whitest salt.

A.response_text: Go back down the stairs to the Amphitheater

B.response_text: Walk down the southern stairs into the Archives

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0099.000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Before Fwayya can succumb to her injuries, a look of proud determination falls upon a point behind Eidos. Turning about, she sees that summons unheard have called forth the master of this fortress. The sinewy frame of Khlutt, commander of the Tacribian League, now silently glides up onto the walls.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0099.001!DESCRI.dialogue_text: Moving with a feline grace, the click of the mage's hobnail sandals mark the time as he paces a circle about her. His face has all the emotion and stability of a stone archway, yet unambiguously promises a destruction utter and absolute...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!999.X000!DESCRI.dialogue_text: The battle has taken its toll on Eidos. Having exerted her Falseflesh far beyond its limits, she drops to her knees, breath quickening until she loses all control. Guards pour in, several fearlessly stepping forward to restrain her. They soon realize, however, that her own body has already done them this favor. Now cruelly acting as ally to her enemies, her stiff muscles petrify her into a pitiful facsimile of a statue. Eidos can only watch helplessly while they bind her hands and feet as they would a hog.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!999.001!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Other guards inspect the body of their fallen mage and shake their heads in confirmation of his departure from the Falseflesh. In clockwork unison, the warriors gather around Eidos. Wordlessly, they move, as though compelled by the unspoken directives of their slain commander, the flame of his instructions still burning brightly within them. Stone-faced, they begin their task, like a cadre of unthinking, unfeeling Neverborn automata.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!999.002!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: One of the soldiers then crouches down at her side to begin ruthlessly packing a band of cloth down her throat. Each passing moment fuels her insufferable anticipation of the end.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!999.003!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: Anticipation of when the air runs out.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!999.004!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: As asphyxiation gradually overcomes her will to persist, it relentlessly extracts what little life remains from her Falseflesh. With each excruciating bid for breath, her vision slowly blurs. Lines widen and distort, while shapes expand and merge.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!999.005!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: The plurality returning to its singularity.

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!999.006!DESCRIP.dialogue_text: The warriors somberly sing a mournful dirge for their fallen leader as they witness Eidos' departure from the Falseflesh, knowing she will now go to do battle with Khlutt in the Graylands...

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.000!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "I am Valvorthr Fwayya, bound by honor to Shariken Shen."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.001!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "Ark willing, I offer you my ear, that I may somehow aid you as a final service in Her name."

D.response_text: "Why are you so keen to help me?"

E.response_text: "What is it you could do for me?"

F.response_text: "And I am Stalphos Gremlinsbane. Why is your name so weird?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.100!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "I act as a Ranger of the Tacribian League."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.1000!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "Our task is to patrol the near Waste in search of threats to the Dawn Fortress."

A.response_text: "Why have you accepted such a dangerous task?"

B.response_text: "Have you seen anything that would pose a danger?"

E.response_text: "I intend on entering the Wasteland; join me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.200!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "I was just... looking out over the Wasteland."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.2000!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "It is my duty to patrol it for threats, and I shall soon enter the Wastes again."

A.response_text: "Why have you accepted such a dangerous task?"

B.response_text: "Have you seen anything that would pose a danger?"

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.3000!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "My circuit draws near and the Wastes demand my presence, but if need should arise before I depart, I will do whatever I can to assist you."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.3001!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "For the good of the League and the future of Kabu."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.400!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "I am a Ranger of the Tacribian League, and my task is to patrol the near Waste in search of threats to the Dawn Fortress."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.4000!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "However, my ultimate duty is to serve the realm of Kabu and the children of Biracul."

D.response_text: "Perhaps an exchange of information?"

E.response_text: "I intend on entering the Wasteland. I want you to join me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.500!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "I do not know how I could assist you."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.5000!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "As a Ranger of the Tacribian League, it is my task to patrol the near Waste in search of threats to the Dawn Fortress."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.5001!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "However, my ultimate duty is to serve the realm of Kabu and the children of Biracul."

A.response_text: "Why have you accepted such a dangerous task?"

D.response_text: "Perhaps an exchange of information?"

E.response_text: "I intend on entering the Wasteland. I want you to join me."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.6000!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "Well, it's at least as common as Ark or Yarmak, certainly."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.6001!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "I suspect from your directness, though, that there is a dearth of friends in your life..."

F.response_text: "It can be pretty lonely as the only immortal in this book..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.1010!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "But it's a duty to which many felt I was suited."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.1011!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "I only wish that I don't disappoint my comrades."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.X1012!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "But now I must go; may Biracul guide you, outlander."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.201!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "Indeed, all who enter the Wasteland encounter sights that would be best left unseen."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.2010!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "I suggest you alter your course and stay far from the Wastes."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.401!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "I know very little but the ways of the Wasteland, outlander."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.4010!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "All I can say is that it is a land of inevitable suffering; best to avoid it."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.501!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "It is the duty of all Rangers to enter the Wasteland only with their fellow Tacribians; we work best when we are responsible for own."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.5010!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "But if you were to find yourself in danger in the Wastes and a Ranger were present, they are honor-bound in the name of Ark to assist you."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.X6010!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "But, now I must go; may Biracul heal your ghost in the fires of Awareness, outlander."

F.response_text: "Crack a few crystals and I can make some decent fires... Hmm..."

KABU!DAWN FORTRESS!WALLS!0.899!FWAYYA!.dialogue_text: "Outlander, my time is near, but for now I would prefer to etch this landscape into my memory..."
